column5: Do you still deliver to BFPO addresses?

Well tried Asda this week due to amount of problems had with Tesco! And so far so good!! But not hard when constantly getting bad dates on items! Or deliver your shopping elsewhere or even leave all your fresh produce on the van!!

Very disappointed with tesco delivery tonight. Had a text earlier with  sincere apologies  that my delivery would be late. Two hours late and still another 45 minutes until my new scheduled time. Forcing people to stay up late is crazy. We have a young baby and no doubt will be woken up by her early so waiting up for my shopping is ridiculous. Let s wait and see if my shopping actually arrives or even if I get anymore details from tesco. One text isn t sufficient to keeping the customer informed. Especially when no reason is given!!! No wonder I stopped using tesco before. Wish I d never come back

I looked on your website for vouchers for west Midlands safari park to take my 6 & 7 year old. Your website stated up to 30minutes for both emails  one confirmation and one with the voucher to be delivered. We decided to wait until the morning of going to check on the weather  ordered at 8.15  conformation email came through at 8:18  waited (whilst checking) until 9:20 before calling. Got the car and children packed up ready  and would like to point out that myself and husband had taken the day off work. Then told on the phone that the website is incorrect and it can take up to 2 hours! The lady on the phone checked to see if this could be accelerated only to be told by the support team that there is a delay and that the vouchers can take up to 4 hours now due to system traffic. So I had everything  including the children packed in the car  and 2 options  ruin everybody s day by saying that were not going and waste a day off work or pay out over ¬£100 for us all to go!  Thank you very much Tesco for false advertising  upsetting me on a rare day off  delaying our day and losing me money  as had I not have been using the clubcard points we would not go or mention this to our children as we cannot really afford to pay out over ¬£100 on 1 day but now have no other choice!

Not sure what has happened to your grapes of late but the 500g punnet of seedless grapes have been dreadful! The packaging says sweet  crisp and juicy however I have found them soft and sour and seriously lacking in flavour! We regularly buy grapes (2/3 packs a week) but the last few from you haven t been good üòî

Just a quick question is it true that you are going to stop selling  Easter  eggs as it offends some religious groups. As a Christian country why are we losing our Christian values? The Easter egg symbolises the stone from the tomb rolling away when Jesus rose from the dead. All faiths should be able to live together in harmony and respect each other s beliefs. I don t complain about other religious groups festivals and I don t think it s right that ours can t be tolerated.

I don t usually write reviews but I just wanted to say a massive thank you. Both my husband and step-daughter are gluten free and the choice is always boring/limited and expensive! I went online and found that you had 10x more products available at a much more reasonable cost as it was your own brand. It cost ¬£1 for delivery and the man that delivered was really  really helpful  friendly and knowledgable. Then you gave us a card and a choccy bar to say thanks for shopping with you.  I genuinely feel as a parent to a child that usually misses out she ll be thrilled to see some of the goodies we now have!  Thank you x

Have to say Tesco have made a huge mistake in cutting its cleaning contractors hours. Some by 1/2 their weekly hours and by gosh it shows. The store is messy  toilets unclean and Tesco staff kicking the wrapping from shelf replenishing   would prefer they picked it up and disposed of it properly. If you need to save money try some other way  not on cleaning. I await your reply.

For Tesco Brockworth  we cannot thank the staff in store this evening enough for their help & professionalism when our daughter Evie-Mae cut her eye. Karen the manager & the two Hannah s kept calm and helped in every way possible. You truly have hearts of gold & Evie will be telling all her friends about it!  It s reassuring to know how well Tesco train your staff in first aid especially with children so thankyou!

Just want to say a big thank you to the produce staff at Tesco Potters Bar for all the boxes they managed to get for me  then took out to my car  then found even more for me a few hours later! Moving house is stressful  but they managed to take a little of that away.

Good evening Tesco  I wanted to let you know that I received a scam email in your name today. I couldn t find a contact email address on your site (probably not looking properly). I was going to forward it to you in case you could do something about it. I don t like to think that this email is duping people elsewhere.

Did a big shop with Tesco last weekend  should have known better  Not sure what Beef they use in the Beef & Red Wine Casserole they are selling but it was totally inedible full of Gristle and Fat  its gone in the Bin  Does anyone carry out QC on this food for goodness sake?? You guys need to seriously up your game...its simply not good enough!!

Very disappointed just spent ¬£123 in Beccles Tesco s to find we have a parking fine ¬£70 because we exceeded the 2 hours allowed.  Regularly spend ¬£100 a week or more  think we may now shop in nearby Morrison s
Is there any reason why the petrol prices are now going up by 1p a week? Other supermarkets are holding their prices. Oil has not gone up in price. Tesco s raking it in again?

Just wanted to say I was very happy to see a parking Marshall at my local tesco store today. I m sick and tired of seeing people with children park in parent and child space and people who aren t blue badge holders park in disabled spaces. Please tell me you are thinking of extending this to more stores!!
Could you cut back or actually stop using so much plastic packaging. I don t use your shop so much any more because of it. thanks :)
Can t believe how rude a member of your staff was in tesco express Great Yarmouth   no need to talk to customers like that !!!

Hi   I ve just found a screw in a 2 pint  blue milk  from one of your Huntingdon stores.  I am rather concerned as I have a little boy and I was pouring it in his cup when I found it. He is 3 and could of choked so I am worried incase anyone else has one in theirs.
When does clubcard boost start again?
Why have you swapped Warburtons Danish bread for Kingsmill at my local shop in Heysham? Warburtons is much better.

Hi Tesco on March 16th I wrote to your customer services department. Included in the note was a biscuit that had blue cloth in it  similar to a J cloth.. An acknowledgement of this letter would have been nice or is it usual to sell contaminated food at Tesco?
Do you ship over seas to the USA

Just want to say a massive thank you to the staff in Tesco Express Verwood  Dorset  I looked for my debit card today and couldn t find it anywhere! To remember that I used it in my local Tesco Express store a FEW DAYS ago!! Went back there today and they still had it!  Thank you so so much again!

How is it acceptable that you can sell a laptop with  plenty of space for photos  music and document files  when it struggles for space to run Windows 10  and then say that it isn t faulty or not fit for purpose? I have spent nearly ¬£300 (laptop and Microsoft) and can t use them but you won t offer a refund!
It there truth in a statement I just read that in 2017 no Easter eggs will be sold with an EASTER logo on it please .

Nice to see your stores offer such great customer service...can you change a ¬£10 note for 2x ¬£5 please whilst I m paying for my goods? Answer no we don t change notes!!! Could understand if it was a ¬£50 note or even if they suspected it was fake but didn t even look at the note or offer an explanation! Will be taking my custom to Sainsburys or Asda where they actually serve customers!!!!

I ve already had to make a complaint to your customer service for the quality of your products. I have a pint of milk with a sell by date of the 5th of April and it s gone off. I ve been at work all day no one s used it. Not the first time with the milk and I had chicken last week which had 3 days to be used by and was green when I opened it!!!! Disgusting
Hi   There is a post on facebook stating Tesco have removed the word  Easter  from their Easter eggs so as not to offend other religions - please confirm?

Very disappointed in your service today. We had a delivery booked for between 12 & 1 today. We waited until 1.30 & then called to find out what was going on - no contact from you. We were told it would be up to 45 minutes late. This meant we went without lunch as that was coming in the delivery. We waited another hour & still no delivery.  At approx 2.40pm we had had a call saying that our delivery had been delayed & would not arrive until between 5.30 & 6.30pm. This was totally unacceptable as we eat dinner at 6.30 & it had fresh food to be cooked for tonight s meal  a fresh chicken salad requested (a family tradition) by our daughter for her birthday meal this evening. We have been told there is no way to prioritise our delivery & offered a maximum of ¬£15 as compensation. This would not even cover the price of the meal we have to now go out & buy elsewhere  let alone compensate messing up our youngest daughter s birthday lunch & also risking her birthday dinner.  We have been loyal Tesco customers for several years but due to this we intend to go elsewhere in future & will be cancelling our delivery saver option & hope you will not make that difficult too. Signed an upset & stressed out mother.

Question Tesco. A couple of weeks ago some prepared veg were 3 for ¬£4. The veg medley I wanted to buy on this offer were ¬£2.20 per pack. As a single person I couldn t get through 3 packs before the dates were up. So instead I bought 2 packs costing me 40p more than buying 3 and throwing one away. How is that helping with food waste?

Very disappointed in the way I have been messed around with my current purchase of a Pergola  delivered with parts missing  promised twice further that the parts are being delivered waiting in and taking 2 days holiday to be messed around then saying in email it wasn t loaded again! Still at square one as parts still missing and no delivery dates apart from ridiculous emails from Grange Fencing who act on behalf of Tesco and I believed I was dealing in email with Tesco and then told I can cancel my order when most of it is erected in my garden incomplete and now fully out of pocket! B&Q perhaps would have been a safer bet. Don t get caught out people!  Terrible Customer Services!  Not Happy!!
Tesco delivery slots prices have increased a lot  not many ¬£1 slots available now. First the ¬£25 to ¬£40 increase and now this. Bit unfair for the smaller families.

My husband has just been to Chesterfield Road branch Mansfield.I am ill with flu and he bought me a new pair of PJs.Only problem is the cheekout assistant did not take the security tag  so I am unable to wear them.They are on the till receipt at ¬£10.Train your staff please.We now have to make another trip to take them back  more petrol...

You need to stop using Arrow XL as a courier!!!Terrible customer service and I still don t have my trampoline. I have 2 very upset daughters now because we are half way through the holidays and we don t even know when it will arrive!!!
Is it true that you will no longer be selling Easter eggs as of 2017?

Please tell me why your diary free Easter eggs were not reduced to half price like all the other eggs after Easter? I find this to be discriminating. Vegan chocolate is more expensive and we can t even have any perks. One disappointed customer!

So sorry folks  but if we expect delivery drivers to ensure that all our needs ordered are in good condition and not out of date we can too in the store when shoshopping. You save so much time and frustration.

Just bought Tesco s own brand of Soda Crystals for ¬£1.  I thought this was a bit steep and found I could get it for 65p in Home Bargains.  What a swizz.  35% dearer for Tesco own brand. Oh but that s ok because I was 10p cheaper than Asda  Morrison s and Sainsbury s for my total shop.  :-/

I am appalled with the service i just received from Tesco  Pengam Green  Cardiff. I returned a broken DVD player i bought last week - still fully packaged - as it is not working. I didn t have the receipt so understood i could not have a refund. However  i was told i could not have a credit note but could exchange the ¬£20 instore there and then for items of that price  but not for groceries. I was  allowed  to include a few items of groceries but no more than that - everything else had to be from the electrical dept. I asked what to do as i didn t want to spend ¬£20 on electricals and was told to return another time when i did want to spend ¬£20 but still could not have a credit note. I ended up buying a few items of groceries and 2 DVD s to use up the money - which i did not even want to buy. I was pressured into buying them there and then as i could not have a credit note - even though that s what customer services do for those without a receipt usually - and I was effectively  told  how to spend my money instore. I shop at Tesco and needed groceries  but was told i could not exchange for those!! Disgusting policy you have there!!!
is it true you will not sell easter eggs that have the word easter printed on them ?????

My shopping has just been delivered. The driver is always polite and friendly. He s an asset to your company.  I ordered some  roast potatoes  but they are actually little new potatoes. The packaging clearly says roasts.....I d call them little potatoes with their skin on üòè Not a happy customer.

i recently purchased a tin of tesco spagetti hoops and on opening it i was shocked to the core what i found i have sent pictures and a email to tesco but still have not had a reply how disgusting is that

disgusted that tesco express on frindsbury hill would not allow us to put up a missing dog poster as dog went missing a few roads away... other local businesses happy to support local people so why can t tesco! will encourage people to avoid and shop local!
Tesco why  when you deliver my shopping  do think it s appropriate to subsitute gluten free items for those that are not?

Recently I noticed a change in tesco nappies they have always been my brand of choice until the last 3 packs I bought. They changed the fit which I thought was great at first until I noticed every time my boy had a wee there would be those absorbing crystals everywhere... I put it down to the first few so kept using but this has happened to each pack now... Fixed the design but ruined the absorbancy. I will switch to a different brand from now on.
I love my steak... @tesco I used to buy the single steaks at ¬£3 now they ve gone up to ¬£5.20.... How? Why? I think your cows are ripping us off! I need my meat!! üòÅ

oh Tesco you have just made some people very happy!! Your Community Champion Hayley from the Great Yarmouth Store just turned up at Avery Lodge with her manager Sue and made a present of 6 large boxes of Guylian Chocolates and and a very large box of books for our residents  bless you for thinking of us. <3

1.what will be the benefit of Tesco company when it provides training to it s staff based on company benefits operations and the individual benefits? 2.And what is the purpose of Tesco company to provide training and development to its workers?

Due to the fact that you have decided to drop the word  Easter  from your chocolate eggs..for fear of offending certain faiths..you have offended mine ..so I will not be buying Easter Eggs (Proper title) from any of your stores now and in the future !!

Hi Tesco  Just a quick enquiry. What happened to your sensible priced delivery slots. I used to shop with Tesco all the time but the last 3 times i have looked to book an online delivery slot it has been 4 or 5 pounds unless i want it delivered late at night which due to a health condition i cannot. The last 2 shops i have done have been with another supermarket that delivered for ¬£2 each time which maye not sound much of a difference but it adds up. Please don t take this as a complaint I am just bringing it to your attention. My husband is able to drive so can use Tesco frequently but health stops me from driving which means i rely upon a good value delivery service. I hope you all have a good day  and i hope you do not mind me bringing this to your attention.

My sister bought beds from Tesco Direct and waited in on Wednesday the 30th March  there was no communication from either Tesco or their carrier Arrow to say they could not delivery and when she phoned Tesco at 7.00pm approx was informed that it was not in Stock !!!  They have the money and they never said it was not available at time of order. What shocking service   and then the customer service advisor asked what she wanted them to do???
Super annoying to find the wafer ham slice I bought yesterday at Tesco express Ruislip has today s date on it. I expect to check dates on the bread when buying  but not ham
Tesco what is all this going around about Easter eggs and you not selling them next year is it true
How come you cant double up your club card points for beer and wine anymore ? Sainsburys let you with nectar points ! Customer loyalty should be repaid :-)
over a week ago I complained about your Tesco finest Carrot Cake and I am still waiting to here back from Tesco what s the hold up ?
Just eating a pack of olives I bought yesterday and I ve noticed they are 2 weeks out of date  shocking! üò∑

I don t think I have ever written on a retailers facebook page before but having arrived on your grocery homepage to see your 7 new farms announced has compelled me to do so. I understand the concept of marketing but you are trading on the goodwill and  IP  that hard working British Farmers  own  in launching these cynical names. It is a clear attempt to lure your customers into believing something that isn t true whilst hoping a high percentage will be taken in by it. As a Tesco shopper  I just wanted to register with you that I think this an ill considered move and one that ought to be beneath an organisation of your size and stature.

Would just like to praise your staff at the Bletchley Milton Keynes store.  After going shopping and my card declining to only find that my card had been cloned and all my money was taken out of my account your staff at your branch in Bletchley  Milton Keynes were so very helpful and took the pressure off me. I was able to feed my two children because of the kind act of your staff. My bank account was wiped out by cowards who left me with nothing. But I was able to still go home with milk in my babies tummies thank you to your amazing helpful staff.  Thank you so much. Your staff are amazing.  Thank you Tesco ‚ù§Ô∏è

Hi Tesco    The old saying goes if a customer is happy they tell 3 people  if a customer is unhappy they tell 9+. Well when the audio on the TV I bought from you less than three weeks ago stopped working I certainly told my 9 people  but I will happily tell more than 9 people (well however many will see this actually) how very impressed I am with the customer service of your employees in dealing with the return on the tele. I rang the store to make sure it was correct to return to them they directed me to the electrical helpline  5 minutes later I had a returns code  an apology for the inconvenience and wished a Happy Easter.   When I arrived in store with me & my mum carrying the boxed TV one of the in store people came and took it off us and asked where we were going & then took us to the returns desk at the tech team. About 5 minutes later the refund was issued  no quibble and we were thanked for our custom and wished a good day.   When the sound stopped I dreaded a long & drawn out returns procedure  presumed I d be fobbed off to the manufacturer & messed round having to send it off to be assessed on whether it was fixable or just to replace/refund but my experience was very much the opposite.   Thanks  Tesco. You made the whole experience much more manageable  well done. Good customer service is rare these days üëç

Dear Tesco I Take great Offence at the at your decision about your Easter Eggs   what other time of the year would you have easter eggs? I suppose you will also take CHRISTMAS off everything before September  so you DONT  OFFEND anyone Well it flipping well OFFENDS ME that you do these things  WE are a CHRISTIAN country and if OTHER religions DECIDE to  emigrate here THEY should ACCEPT our way of life.    It is OUTRAGEOUS YOU HAVE DECIDED THIS COURSE OF ACTION.

So today we visited Tesco extra in fratton  Portsmouth  my 4 year old little girl was upset because we walked to soft play to find it was closed  popped in to Tesco to buy some bits and treat our lil one to some sweets  we were guided to the basket checkout and served by a lovely man named Thomas  who let our little girl sit at the checkout and scan her own sweets! This made her day as her big sister works on checkouts in this store and she has always wanted to be just like her big sister  so thankyou Thomas  you really cheered our girl up. I would add the photo but there is no option to do so.
Why can t we order #giantcrumpets online through Tesco? üëé
How to disappoint your new husband at Easter...... Buy a ¬£5 chockablock Easter egg and only get half!!!!

Purchased an expire product on Old Kent Road store in London. Cooked and served to all my family. Two young kids both under 3  me and my husband. Left the package empty on the kitchen worktop and after dinner I realised was expired.  Raised a complaint and been answered that this is uncommon for them to have certain situations but can happen although they are trying to give to the staff the right training. Unbelievable. The only thing I can say is unbelievable. I ll go certainly further. The only things I m happy is that nothing happened to my children and us.

I purchased tesco finest brioche it was reduced on Monday got it home to find out it was Best before 23/03/2016 so 4 days out of date. Took it back the next day to have just a refund! So 50p for Brioche that was 4 days out of date and a sorry im eextremely disappointed and i have emailed a complaint but heard nothing.I should of taken it further and glad i didnt give it to my daughter.

Following on from my complaint on Sunday! I have done what was asked of me and I m still waiting for a reply from your management team as my complaint had supposedly been escalated?! To where  Australia by hand?? If this is how you treat DISABLED customers well bravo Tesco! I am disgusted that you deem this unimportant and will be certain I don t shop with you again!!

I just had the most rancid lemon tart from your store today  I ve had this tart before and it tasted fine but this time it didn t taste anything like it was meant to  it tasted meaty and overpowering taste of Lemon I don t know what has gone wrong with is but it tasted awful! honestly regret buying it!
Is it true that Tesco are to drop the word Easter from their eggs next year?

Bought some long-life milk off you in my online shopping. It was delivered today (around half four/five) and it has today s date on it. Is that some sort of weird Tesco joke that I don t get? Long life milk. Today s date. Ha ha ha ha ha. No.

Just wanted to say thank you for excellent service - again!  I d forgotten to use the clubcard vouchers when I made a big purchase.  I rang more in hope than expectation but it was all sorted out and the guy on the phone was lovely - and very tolerant!   The grocery delivery guys are great and I these days I like to go to Tesco before I go anywhere else.
Whenever I buy tesco bread it always has a large hole down the middle of the loaf and I end up with holy sandwiches

Disappointed that you have changed one of the finest pizzas my bloody favourite one as well  was happily tucking in when I thought this still tastes of mushroom (I pick the big ones off) look at the packet to find the mascarpone cheese has been mixed with mushrooms and pepper YUCK turned me right off. WHY WHY WHY.......................Feeling hungry üôÅ
Trying to do an online shop  but so far apparently you no longer sell red onions  potatoes  eggs  carrots or mince or chicken. Seriously...wtf?
Hi there who can I contact with regards to donations to support a fund raising event? Thank you

Why have you stopped your 3 for ¬£10 offer on meat?? Seriously don t know whether I will shop at Tesco now. Especially as the  deal  you have on meat now  is a few pounds off cheap  high fatty meat cuts. Just not good enough Tesco. You re supposed to be encouraging customers to shop with you  unfortunatley you have now made me want to do the complete opposite.

Have you changed your nappies? I bought a packet last week and noticed the side straps were different. But since I have been using them they seem to irritate my little girl  she has had a sore bum and has a red irritated band around her back where the waist band is. It s really sore and bothering her to the extent I ve been out and bought another supermarket brand tonight as she can t sleep in them. Please let me know what you have done to them as Tesco nappies have always performed best in the past!

I do my shopping on line with you and have done for a long time.  recently week on week I am findng you hvae more and more everyday items unavailable with no decent alternative.  things like beef mince  brown onions  potatoes  your own thin ham.  I have to then buy a more expensive version if you even have one available.  i know i could get all of these items if I went to my local store so why are they not availabe online?  I am seriously considering ordering from another supermarket due to this.

Would you please explain  if true....why for Easter 2017 you will not be supplying EASTER EGGS with the word EASTER printed on them. Also who are the people who have complained about this or is this a crafty way of marketing!?!?!?!? xxx Thank you

Why has Tesco put the price of fuel up at mine  and other stores that have petrol stations???? The cost of crude oil has reduced by almost 3%. Gasoline has reduced by 1%. There was no increase in the latest government budget but you see fit to increase your prices by over 3%. Where is the reasoning of justification behind this??? To coin your phrase;  Every Little Helps  (to line your pockets).
i have trying for a week now to sign up for paperless statements to no avail. can anyone on here help?

Hi  we re placing an online order for 9-10am tomorrow  and it won t allow us to add Bavaria 0% Wheat Beer due to licensing restrictions. As it s alcohol-free there s presumably no reason to not allow it to be sold at that time - do you perhaps have the product set up wrong?

Just wanted to say a big thumbs up to Tesco Bank and Tesco Clubcard for their faultless customer service! I ve been so impressed with Tesco Credit Card  their system and ease of use and flexibilty (which beats that of many others)- cheers guys!!
seems to be a fair few disgruntled customers here Tesco don t you think it s time you did the right thing and took customers views seriously instead of the back and forth apologies that go nowhere

Bought one of your red kite high chairs for my son. Bought it when he was about 6 months old. He is now 18 months but it has started to literally come apart at the seams. Where the shoulder strap are have ripped and more worryingly the seat seams are coming undone spilling the insides out.   I down expect one of your products to last 12 months. Especially something that is meant to last at least a few years. Not impressed.

I m raging it s taken you five days to still sort out my voucher for ¬£10 and now my coffee maker I wanted to buy has gone up by ¬£81 I m furious with Tesco and all your silly messages too and throw your customer service is the worst I have ever seen all that hassle you have give me and now I can t even afford to buy it now disgusted

Really disappointed with the spinach bags now....the price is the same ¬£1  BUT the leaves have long tough stalks  and the worst change is.....it NEEDS washing......very inconvenient when using in a quick smoothie in the morning! Why can t it be pre washed still?

I wanted to sincerely thank you for finally making a completely Free From Garlic Baguette! I was ecstatic to find it in one of my local stores recently and am pleased to say I enjoyed it. I honestly couldn t tell the difference between that and other regular Garlic Breads.   I ve had various food allergies most of my life  especially Lactose-Intolerance and had always hoped something like this would be made. So  thank you very much!üëçüòéüòÄüéâ  P.S. I was also pleased to find you ve also made Free From Choc Ices too  which I will be enjoying this Summer!üëçüòÄ‚òÄÔ∏è

BUYER BEWARE - well it s nearly 5oclock it s obvious now the laptop is not going to be collected. Not at all surprised  please beware buying from Tesco partners  if things go wrong no one wants to sort it. I can only assume Tesco are making big money from allowing their so called partners to sell via their website  easy profit for no work  would you care to comment on this Tesco  how much do you make from these sales?

TESCO i am disgusted with the service recieved and the lies sent via your chat operators through email to myself please inbox me your head office telephone number as seems all you do is pass the book and leave customers frustrated and annoyed at the lack of concern shown towards them im afraid without customers tesco wouldnt work so heres another unhappy customer who will shop elsewhere ty!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Dear Tesco  I recently placed a order from Tesco direct(22/3)and was made aware the items were only available to be delivered and not available for collection... I paid and arranged for delivery for Thursday last week and waited in all day...Nothing came...I contacted the couriers who said they weren t able to deliver on Thursday and I would have to wait till the following Tuesday(due too bank holidays)....Tuesday has been and gone and still I ve received nothing and having just phoned the couriers have been informed I won t be receiving anything till next Tuesday now  a whole 2 weeks after purchasing the items(with a total cost of over ¬£1000) Tesco  you may be better off looking at more reliable couriers than Arrow Xl!! Disappointed to say the least!

Hats off to Sarah at the Customer Service desk in Tesco   Milford Haven. My little girl was sad to find a manky Easter egg in the box on Sunday morning. I returned it yesterday and Sarah was very understanding and sympathetic. She gave me a full refund  two complimentary boxes of chocolates and assured me that I would hear from Head Office or the manufacturer within two weeks. Da iawn!

Thanks Tescos VERY EMBARRSING. Not only did you refused vouchers exclusive to yourself  to also refused legitimate P & G voucher. Had to waste phone cost ringing P & G to inform them that you Tesco don t want to use their vouchers!!! Oh and will I m moaning how about not having all management seemily going on there lunch break at 11pm. I m not coming the next day to speak to customer services and waste petrol. Thanks a bunch!!!!!

Dear Tesco  I am sad and humiliated by the lack understanding of transgender. I am a  trans male and I was in galashiels tesco when I needed to use the toilet. It is hard to use the toilets as a trans man as I am afraid of being discriminated for using the men s.  I went to the customer service desk and explained my situation. The woman at the desk told me not to worry and I can use the men s.  While I was washing my hands I noticed a man come in and walk back out. When I came out I noticed the man was a security guard who pointed out it was the men s toilet. I explained why I used them and he said I should use the ladies. I told him I was told I was allowed and he told me to wait while he spoke to her. I got impatient and went to the desk where the lady said she thought I was taking my son into the ladies toilets.  She said she misunderstood me and was not listening properly when I said I am trans male and I want to know of the toilets are trans friendly. I did not mention a son  I don t even have a son. They advised I use the disabled toilets  I said I wasn t disabled and they pointed out it s also for people who do not have a visible disability.   I am not disabled and I am appalled that the lady at costumer services lied to the security guard about what she told me. I left the store humiliated as I was confronted in the middle of the doorway to the men s toilets in front of people wanting to use it and was asked by one what the problem was also the woman lying to protect herself. If you are not trans friendly then say so as it s hard enough I have to sneak in mens toilets to avoid confrontation and now I have been put in that situation out of coawrdness from one of your staff.  I am man therefore I should have access to the men s toilets without a problem.

NOT very happy with my local store. They refused  Charlie Bighams ¬£2.00 off voucher which states exclusive to TESCOS!!!! Not a happy person. People need to be aware of the small print when ordering from Tesco.   I placed an order this morning and my money was taken straight away.  I then received an email to say that my order had been confirmed. 10 minutes later  I received another email saying that there was a problem with my order and that it was being caneclled. No expalanation in the email at all. I rang Tesco to be told that my item was out of stock. I explained that I had paid and received a confirmation email. I was told that Tesco do not have a live ordering system and that there was no guarantee that I would get what I had paid for.  I said surely you can t be allowed to take money for goods that you know you can t supply and was told it is not illegal and it does state this in the terms and conditions small print. I now have to wait up to 5 working days for a refund. Be aware that if you need a product urgently  Tesco can keep your money for 5 days  even though it was never in stock in the first place.  I can t afford to buy another product until I get my refund in 5 days.

Dear Mr Tesco   For many years now a Bourbon has been my chosen accompaniment alongside a cup of tea  but not one of those upmarket brand Bourbon creams which are clearly not real Bourbons.   No my chosen Bourbon is a Tesco own brand  so I would like to express my disappointment and my utter shock at when approximately two months ago my local Tesco Extra in Dudley had unfortunately ran out of Bourbons (they had the upmarket ones but as I said I don t like those).   Now my first thought was  ok it will be alright I shall return tomorrow to purchase said Bourbons . I have returned most days over the past two months however when I make my way to the biscuit isle hoping and praying I will be able to purchase my desired Bourbons I am greeted by an horrific sight  right next to the custard creams (where said Bourbons usually live) there is simply an empty space  much like the empty space in my heart.   I realise to some it s just a Bourbon but to me it s my morning treat  the one thing I get to look forward to in the morning. it s been two months now and the withdrawal symptoms are bringing to show.  I hope you  Mr Tesco can bring an end to the national shortage of Bourbons.   Thank you

Dear Tesco  I am sad and disappointed at having to write this on Easter of all days but I have been left with a nasty taste in my mouth..  I purchased my husband and myself a tichy chokablok billionaires dynamite egg for Easter  the promise of milk chocolate with honeycomb pieces  chocolate coasted shortcake biscuit and fudge chunks made my eyes light up and I knew me and my husband would be in for a treat on Easter Sunday this being our only egg.  Imagine our delight as we both opened the box and just sat staring at our egg in our hands  drooling over the chocolatey honeycomby fudgy shortcakey goodness before us.  Then we took our first bite and that s when it all went down hill.  Nowhere on the box does it state that the  milk chocolate  would be coffee flavoured  No where does it state that there should be a taste of coffee at all in our Easter egg.  Now my husband is not a coffee drinker  I drink it but I m not a coffee flavoured chocolate fan  My Easter has been ruined and I imagine my 4 nieces I brought the same egg for will not be overly impressed either.  This has spoilt what was shaping up to be a good day Tesco  I hope your happy!  Please in future could you state on your packaging of eggs if the chocolate is coffee flavoured so others do not have to go through the same heartbreak as we have  Yours sincerely  Lindsay shepherd Chocoholic

Now  I know myself and many other Tesco s customers like a good old bargain. But today I witness pure greed whilst at the Tesco s store located in Pitsea  Essex. Myself and my other half were looking at the reduced sections around the store and we had noticed that people had literally filled their trollies so high with reduced food items. So high that other customers thought that the trollies weren t being used by another customer. This customer had over 9 tubs of 1p grapes. Which fair enough if you like grapes go for it but what about everyone else?. I m sure many other customers would agree that you should only be allowed a certain amount of reduced items in your basket/trolley. What about people that struggle to provide for their families and rely on reduced food to get them by? Even if this customer struggled themselves it is still pure greed to have so many items from the reduced section without thinking of other people. And this didn t happen at just one point of my shop at Tesco s it also happened at the bakery reduced where a woman had filled her trolley full of bread and cakes that people then again thought that it was being used to put reduced items in. I think it will be a great idea to start putting a cap on the amount of reduced food you can have on your shopping trip. Less greed. More consideration.  Thanks  Jaye Woolford.

Dear Tesco  As a former dairy farm worker  married to an ex farmer with family still in farming   i am shocked to see so much foreign imported meat on your shelves.    Milk prices are at an all time low with many farmers going out of business each week.  Beef prices are falling through the floor.   Surely this means you  as a British Company  can buy at a lower price and support our farmers instead of importing cheap carcasses and labelling them as produced in England when in fact they have only been cut up in England?  Come on Tesco.  Support your customers - dont put them out of business

Still waiting to see how Tesco (Widnes) deals with this  but want to warn people in the meantime.... hoped they would contact me by now but nobody has..... Left my wife s car with the Car Wash people lunch time today  walked across to Next then walked back to go in Tesco. As we walked past the car wash area on the pavement outside (& above) we were shocked to see one of the attendants rooting through a bag my wife had in the boot. (The car was backed in to the car wash bay so we had a very clear view from above). He had a good root around in this bag for at least 30 seconds while we were watching  found nothing valuable so carried on cleaning. (So shocked we didn t think quickly enough to video him). When confronted  none of them understood any English.... Managed to convince him (and his colleagues) that he was a thief and he eventually said sorry. I ve used this car wash before  when it first started they always logged each vehicle in on a tablet device and issued receipts but recently no logging-in or receipts have been happening so that makes you wonder how much of the takings are actually going in the till  and how many items have gone missing from people s cars. Have complained to Tesco but waiting to see how they progress the matter. No one has been in touch yet and this guy is probably still working on site. The Car Wash is operated by a franchise called  Waves  but their publicity leads you to believe it is operated by Tesco.

Just want to say a huge thank you for great customer service Tesco - well done!  I ordered a turkey crown to be delivered on Wednesday and sadly it was out of stock. Hello tesco  I would like to ask you to help start a revolution in the supper markets  there is so much wrong in the way the UK supper markets don t fully support the British farmers  my father in-law is a dairy farmer and struggles to make ends meat because of low prices forcing milk prices lower and lower    The meat industry is finding it harder and harder with lamb and pork farming on its knees because of the mass amount of imports brought in  we have the highest welfare standards for animals and rightly so  however this puts prices up  and yet the market is flooded by Danish pork and lamb from New Zealand   that doesn t meet these welfare standards that we set so why are we eating it.   Not to mention the game industry the UK produces millions of game birds and venison which is a healthy organic and cheap option of meat but not on your shelves    And not to mention the fruit and veg industries as well    What I would like to see happen which I m sure the majority of your customers would also like to see happen  is that Tesco makes a pledge to buy more of British produce  if it can be produced in the UK it should be sourced in the UK at a fair price for the producers creating a fair trade for UK farmers  if it can be UK sourced 80% of the product must come from UK farms  obviously there is stock that can not be UK sourced such as bananas and oranges  but there is plenty of products that could and should be. Support the UK farmers and the UK Will support you    Stand by your nation and set a precedent that all others can follow    So please listen to your customers and stand by the nation that has made you who you are  this would create more jobs in the UK and will benefit the UK and in turn will benefit you with customers becoming loyal to your stores and not moving to other alternatives

A whole list of issues for today. Don t know if stock issues  but I ve heard others having same issues.   Have you stopped selling Swedish Glace? Are you planning to replace it with a different brand or just not sell an alternative to dairy ice cream?  This is the second time we ve been with no oatly chocolate milk. You still have oatly milks as well as many varieties of plant milk. Only sell chocolate milk in lunchbox carton size (3 pack). Please bring it back or stock more of it  or koko chocolate.   You seem to have stopped selling the lemon and lime provamel yogurts. Again you sell the plain one and coconut. The lemon and lime was amazing. As were the other flavoured yogurts.   And now to the major gripe which is cereals. It is a constant battle and the ever changing recipies are maddening. You have followed Kellogs and Sainsbury s by ruining nearly every one by thr addition of vitamin D. The raspberry malties were OK until recently then in came vit D. It s OK I ll just have plain malties  and within two weeks vitamin D has sneaked into those as well. Unlike Nestle s originals. Please get a vegan vitamin D or allow people to supplement themselves  it is maddening.   You ve done a lot of good things of late but all these things add up  if you remove our staples we may as well just shop entirely elsewhere.
So  Tesco- want to explain why you ve put together so much misleading packaging and claimed your food is grown on farms that do not exist?

TESCO  Online Scam  There is a new (to me) online scam offering ‚Ç¨500 in  TESCO vouchers  to participants in a survey. It may be and Ireland only phenomenon but just in case it is more wide spread I m posting here.  For the record I am a happy TESCO / TESCOMobile customer and just want to warn other of a scam that may cost them money.  It claims  TESCO  are considering opening a new center [sic] in Dublin and asks 4 inane questions. After getting 4 responses it asks the name of the UK supermarket with a green logo (ASDA). This takes you to a screen that asks for your mobile number and at the bottom  in tiny type face  it says  ‚Ç¨7.50 per month draw entry fee  plus  ‚Ç¨2.50 per text .  It is run by Mad Prizes* and on retracing my steps there are disclaimers all the way through saying the  survey  is not affiliated with the retailer or product manufacturer named. This leads me to believe there are other similar scams knocking around.  I have no idea how I got to this particular  scam-petition  site as I take the usual precautions browser-wise. It s been a while since I saw a new scam-petition.  The logos and colours are realistic enough to lull the unwary into a false sense of security.   And hey  let s be careful out there; do it them before they do it us.  (Hill Street Blues 198x)  PMMCG

To whom it may concern  I just returned from your bradley stoke store in bristol with my one year old son. Whilst shopping we had a very near miss to what could of been a very serious incident for my son. One of your employees was pushing a large heavy cage quickly up the middle of the Isle.  I had stopped to look at products and as the cage passed us the door which wasn t locked swung round smashing in to our trolley centimetres from my son s head and face. If my son hadn t slightly changed his position in the trolley seconds before  this would have been a serious incident.  Both of us were quite shaken and received a  sorry about that  from your employee which to be honest didn t sound very sorry .. i also reported it to the customer service where I received a half hearted sorry and was told the cage doors are supposed to be locked while moving. My complaint/issue was NOT recorded either which shows that Tesco doesn t really care about what happens to its customers whilst in Tesco premises. I would hate to think of the outcome if my son had been seriously hurt! a half hearted sorry is not good enough in either situation.  Mrs Read

It is hard to believe the cheek of some companies sometimes! Tesco Pet insurance sent a letter today saying that our payments would increase from ¬£15.99 per month to ¬£18.74 from April. We were unhappy with this as we haven t claimed anything. So we decided to look it up online. When we put in the same details on our current policy on the tesco site as if we were looking for a new policy it was only ¬£8.90 per month!! We have cancelled our policy and restarted it but have better cover and half the excess for ¬£12.27 per month! This means that yearly it was ¬£224 and is now ¬£146 for a better policy and half the excess! We are still with Tesco but I would like to ask them why they are trying to cheat their customers out of money!?! I wonder how many people would not check and let it run at the price they say. Surely it counts as fraud!!  Please can somebody contact me to explain this situation.

Hi Tesco.   I ordered some items through Tesco direct for our new house and specifically booked for them to come last Saturday as we work Monday to Friday. The items were due to be delivered by yodel. We were home all day and at around 4.45pm we looked at the yodel tracker and it stated that they tried to deliver and left a card. We were in the flat and no one rang us or buzzed on the apartment intercom and certainly no calling card was left. I then rang your team to complain and was advised that they would book a redelivery for us after 5pm on Tuesday although this could not be guaranteed as yodel don t work like that apparently. My partner then took Tuesday off work to make sure we could get this delivery. The same thing then happened. The tracker said they had tried to deliver and left a calling card. Needless to say we had no phone call  no one rang the buzzer and no calling card was left. My partner had wasted his day off.   I rang your call centre again to try and cancel the order and the lady I spoke to said why don t we just try one more time. So she rescheduled for today Saturday the 26th of March. We have been home all morning and the exact same thing has now happened. There is no possible way yodel have been here as we have been home each time. If there was such an issue with the address they should have called us on the contact number provided. I m so disappointed and have now cancelled the order. I genuinely don t think I ll be shopping with Tesco direct ever again and will just purchase my items elsewhere.

I just wanted to say a massive Thank You to the staff at your Truro store.  Yesterday  after a quick after school shop with two demons in tow  I realised I couldn t find my car keys. Asked at customer services and security  went back to the till  thinking I had perhaps dropped them when I took my purse out my pocket  no luck. Started to retrace our steps  still no sign. Asked a member of staff in one of the aisles if any keys had been handed to him. At this point the store manager started to help us look  along with other staff. The manager escorted us round the store retracing our steps and helped me look through our shopping etc. in search of the missing key. He came out in the rain to look around my car and had staff look through baskets and shelves trying to locate them. He had a member of staff take my kids to the cafe and gave them drawing books to keep them entertained. He waited with me while I called round to check my insurance and get in contact with my family. We live quite far out in the countryside  and the nearest bus stop is the next village along from our little hamlet. As we couldn t find the key I decided to get a taxi home to find the spare. Instead  the absolute star who was looking after my kids (and who s insurance covered it!) offered to take me and my children home  and another member of staff lent us a child seat for my 3 year old. I had to leave the car over night as my Dad had been working away  and I couldn t find the spare till this morning. I can t believe how helpful all the staff were and how they went out of there way to assist me and my children. Absolutely fantastic! Really made a stressful situation so much easier than it could have been.   I went back to thank the manager today  and have promised to give them feedback on your website  but wanted to share it publicly as well. All fabulous people!!!

BUYER BEWARE  on a previous post i explained that i bought a laptop from the Tesco web site and my payment was made to Tesco but Tesco claim i bought it from  Cleverboxes   who i hear you say  yes thats what i said. Now when i go online to buy i don t expect to have to read all the small print on a retailers site for fear of being mislead  key facts should be prominently and clearly displayed (on the Tesco website there was a small Cleverboxes logo) i expected better from Tesco. I asked Tesco if they recieved any profit from my sale although i can t get a straight answer on that but they said  Tesco allow partner companies to sell on our website as a way of showcasing smaller companies products  now i don t for one minute believe that Tesco are allowing rival companies to steal their customers off their website out of the goodness of their hearts with no profit going to Tesco. I have now had sent 9 emails  had 6 or 7 telephone conversations  several FB posts and are still in the same situation  i think the tactic now is to make me feel as if i am being unreasonable.

BUYER BEWARE I bought a laptop off the Tesco website  the money was paid to Tesco (confirmed by my bank statement) it has now failed and when i contacted Tesco the answer was  you bought it from Cleverboxes you should have read the small print  when i revisited the web site i did indeed see a small logo with the name Cleverboxes which meant absolutely nothing to me and i also again down the page saw the same logo which did say sold by Cleverboxes  this meant nothing to me as i had NOT left the Tesco web site or been redirected to Cleverboxes or anyone else and the payment WAS made to Tesco. This is a very dubious if not devious practice as these key facts should be made much clearer not hidden in the reams of small print. Tesco has drawn criticism for using fictional British-sounding farm names on labelling for a range of meat and fresh produce  some of which is imported.  The made-up names are Woodside  Willow and Boswell farms on labelling for pork  chicken and beef  as well as Nightingale and Redmere on salad and vegetable items  Rosedene on berries  apples and pears and Suntrail Farms on a range of imported fruit.  Tesco is using the names on seven new brands which were launched on Monday.  You know it worries me when a Brand named supermarket who years ago I had complete trust in is following marketing practices that leave me questioning their marketing.

The level of anger i have with tesco s right now is absolutely ridiculous. On monday evening i visited your elmers end branch to pick up a few bits before returning home  after around five mins of being in your store two of your colleagues decided it would be a nice idea to go from standing in the middle of an isle having pointless conversation to openly making remarks and gasps about they way i was dressed (if your wondering i am a goth) before i had even walked away from them. I was literally staring at them while they fell silent and then went onto gasp and gossip on the shop floor about what i looked like. I genuinely thought i was going crazy and decided to catch up with my friend and tell her what had just happened and she thought at first that i was over reacting  so a few minutes later we walked past again and she witnessed them do the same if not more offensive remarks and gasps. I was so shocked that this event even transpired ii could barely continue shopping i felt like crying it was absolutely awful. I worked as a member of staff for Tesco for two years myself and know for a fact that this sort of behavior is no tolerated. I chose to take my complaint to a manager who assured me he was sorry and that he would issue an apology from the staff and reprimand their behavior. I left him with an email to contact me and let me know what has happened and have heard nothing back. Only a week ago i was busy reading an article about how staff members had publicly shamed and basically humiliated a girl who used to self harm by refusing service and blaming it on an invisible policy  The worst part is i am not the only person this is happening too i know many people who are left so ashamed they cannot even try to take it further. Why do you feel that it is acceptable behavior for your staff to behave in a manner like this? Two months ago i was being treated for severe clinical depression and had the timing been any different i have no idea what could have happened. I have already been put into a position where we are now having to disscuss my return to medication due to this incident and i cannot even get an apology issued. It s appalling and disgusting to say the least and i will never be placing a foot through the doors of one of your stores again.

Hi Tesco. There is something about my local Tesco srtore that I absolutely love. Its the fact that often when I visit there I see and hear this incredibly talented busker called Josh. He really is so so good - and he s so friendly and polite. I have heard to day that you are banning him from playing. God knows why you don t want him there as I swear he brings people to the store. However what you have said is that he may stop people making donations to local charities. We all know this is nonsense don t we  so can we start behaving like adults maybe? You give Joshua his pitch back or we ll make bloody sure that while people carry on supporting local charities  they stop shopping with you. How does that sound?  Joshua Sole has been busking in and around the Telford area since January 2013. During his time busking he spent many hours playing music in Madeley  where he spent his childhood growing up around the markets with his dad Steve  who is a market trader of 25 years.  Joshua has become a part of the Madeley community and many people  old and young  look forward to hearing Josh and chatting to him  as he is a true local  with roots in the area and many fantastic friends who support his music. Tesco on a few occasions have asked Josh to move along and he has stood his ground and refused  now this week on the 17/3/2016 Joshua was busking in Madeley  when he was approached by a security guard and a Fresh Food Manager and asked to move on. They said Tesco donate to charity and Josh s busking may deter people from donating  so Josh offered that he donates 10% of his busking earning to their instore charities. They declined. He then stated after this weekend  he will be out of the area for some time and asked for this weekend  that the management allow him to busk Friday afternoon 17/3 and Sunday daytime 21/3 for a period not exceeding two hours on each day. They declined.  Since Tesco arrived in Madeley many small local business  have ceased trading and the local market has shrunk to an unrecognisable size due to fierce competition and Tesco s purchasing Madeley. Please sign this petition to show Tesco that we support our local busker s and we wont see massive corporations like Tesco punch down to the small guys  and that we the undersigned support our small local business . Lets try and help Josh get his pitch back for when he is next in Madeley  and also allow other buskers to our small  welcoming and friendly Parish.

No we did not  but we did get an email giving us ¬£10 off our next online shop and thanking us for notifying Tesco of a complaint. we did not complain to Tesco as we had nothing to complain about and it wasn t until we got to your Exeter store that we realised what the online voucher was for. The Staff at your Exeter store was excellent Lisa on the desk and your Dot.com manager was very appologetic. They did everything they could to help us get a few essentials as we couldnt do a full shop as we had our dogs in the car to get us through the next 24hrs. After speaking to a customer services advisor on the phone we did get  told we would receive ¬£20 to cover our fuel as a good will gesture. If we get this voucher I will hold my breath.  Thanks for a completely wasted trip  and we still have empty cupboards. Hope you value this feedback.

Hello Tesco   For my lunch most days I visit one of your many stores across the land to buy my lunch (and sometimes my dinner too).  Sometimes I like a wrap  sometimes I like a pasta salad and sometimes I like a sandwich.  I m a strong believer in the sandwich. It s a solid lunch and there s a type for everyone. BLT  Egg and Cress  all day breakfast  I love them all.  However  I believe you are missing a key gap in the market. No UK supermarket currently stocks a ready made Marmite sandwich.  I m a keen lover of marmite. I lick the stuff out the jar. All I want in life is the ability to walk into a Tesco store and purchase the perfect sandwich filled with my favourite yeast extract.  I m a simple man. I m happy with plain marmite. Feel free to be creative though. Maybe cheese and marmite? Cheese  ham and marmite? I won t bore you with a list of suggestions as I m sure you have a fully capable research and development team.  So come on Tesco  give me the good stuff in a sandwich! Recognise this truly great product and reward marmite fans everywhere!  Yours  Ross Bibby  P.S. Don t fob me off with Vegemite. That stuff is disgusting and yes  I will be able to taste the difference.

I just went online to see the calorie content (for my meal plans) of my favourite gluten free dough balls ever and you are no longer selling them! Instead we have been given just garlic dough balls for 42 calories more and 2.8g of protein less per 3 dough ball serving (trust me  this counts when you are post-op gastric bypass and live on 800-1000 calories a day whilst getting 60-80g of protein in too). You have also added thickeners (which  although the new recipe doesn t contain milk  wheat or egg  many people are sensitive to xanthan gum and guar gum) and doubled the amount of sugar! I can t quite believe that last bit  considering that so many people are now cutting it from their diets - or at least reducing their daily intake considerably - due to the health risks associated with consuming large amounts of it. I can appreciate that you wanted to offer something to those who can t tolerate milk but why take away the old version to replace it with this? Could you not stock both?  Here is a comparison:  1 cheesy garlic dough ball: 36 calories  1.1g protein  Ingredients: Tapioca Starch (Sulphites)  Semi Skimmed Milk  Pasteurised Egg  Emmental Medium Fat Hard Cheese (Milk) (9%)  Mozzarella Cheese (Milk) (9%)  Medium Fat Hard Cheese (Milk) (9%)  Extra Virgin Olive Oil  Garlic Powder (Sulphites)  Salt  White Pepper  1 of the new garlic dough balls: 50 calories  0.1g protein  Ingredients: Potato Starch  Garlic Spread (30%)  Rice Starch  Water  Thickeners (Hydroxypropyl Methyl Cellulose  Xanthan Gum  Guar Gum)  Sugar  Yeast  Salt  Psyllium Husk Powder  Rapeseed Oil  Yeast Extract  Lentils  Acidity Regulator (Sodium Acetate)  Enzymes  Garlic Spread contains: Margarine  Garlic Pur√©e  Water  Garlic Powder  Parsley  Rapeseed Oil  Salt  Onion Powder  Margarine contains: Palm Oil  Water  Rapeseed Oil  Coconut Oil  Emulsifier (Mono- and Di-Glycerides of Fatty Acids)  Flavouring  Vitamin A  Vitamin D  Colour (Beta-Carotene)  I am so disappointed. I m afraid I won t be buying the new ones. The ingredients list for the Cheesy Garlic Dough Balls looks like something I could whip up in my own kitchen... the new recipe doesn t appeal to me at all because of the added ingredients.
2days in a row  you have told me my order will be instore 3pm for click and collect... Well lets just say you lied. I have one very upset child right now....thanks alot üò°üò§üò§

Tesco Evesham -I dont think Tesco Evesham deserves any star rating unless it‚Äôs a minus. I have found the level of customer care sadly lacking. I must say that I have not been to the store for some time following witnessing a supervisor barrating a young lad in front of his colleagues and customers. She was absolutely vile to him and made him cry. Good stuff eh? I challenged the supervisor but I felt it fell on deaf ears. So after a period of absence I returned to the store today and spent over ¬£50 (more fool me!). Whilst in the store I saw on the ‚Äúreduced‚Äù shelves a number of items many of which did not have the yellow reduced label. However  that didn‚Äôt matter as of course everything on the sheves would be reduced and this is clearly stated on the sign above. I picked up some chocolate choux buns which I though my children would like but no label. I spoke to a member of staff who stood by me and asked if she could mark them down. They did by the way have a best before date of today 22/03. She told me that it had nothing to do with her and that I should go to the bakery section who would mark it down. So after thanking her I went off to the bakery section and expalained what had occurred and asked if the lady there could mark down the pastries so I could go to the checkout. This was around 9.30 am. I was met with - ‚Äú I cant do that. Can‚Äôt mark anything down until 10 am‚Äù. Pressing her on the basis that it was 9.30 I was met with a firm ‚Äúno‚Äù. I then asked why  if they had not been reduced  were they on the reduced shelf under the sign that  said everything on the shelf was reduced. She replied that it was nothing to do with her then turned to her colleagues to ask if they knew to which all responded  ‚Äúno  don‚Äôt know anything about it‚Äù. I was then directed to go to a checkout and could have it reduced there. On arrival at the checkout I explained once again the debacle and asked if she could reduce the item as suggested by the bakery staff. ‚ÄúI cant do that‚Äù was the response and suggested the bakery staff would have to do it!! I then pointed out again it was they who sent me to the checkout. A supervisor was called to the checkpout and I had to exp[lain the whole thing again. I was by this time getting very frustrated having been pushed from pillar to post by staff who quite frankly didn‚Äôt want to take responsibility. So what could the supervisor do? Obviously she had been trained to the highest standard in customer relations and seeing how I had been treated  would resolve the problem by marking down the item and offering an apology. Well that‚Äôs how the story should have gone but this is Tesco so no such luck. I was told nothing could be done as it wasn‚Äôt the magic time of 10 am. I repeated that I had been directed around the store and each person I spoke to passed the buck. I queried again the point of placing things on reduced shelves when they were not reduced. Customers could and no doubt do  unwittingly pay full price for things they believe to be reduced.  The supervisor suggested the items must have been placed there by a customer. I expressed the view that this could not be the case unless that customer had deposited several other items which did not have a yellow label. The item‚Äôs best before date was today and as it was clear to be marked down at 10 am  it is more likely to have been put there by the bakery staff.  So what would I say my experience was like? Alsolutely dreadful - no customer care (more like don‚Äôt care). Every little helps?? I don‚Äôt think so!!! When will you learn  Teco  that it is the customers who keeps your shops open??

Experienced awful customer service with your delivery service.  Scheduled an order to be delivered between 8-9pm. No call from the driver. Called Tesco at 9:15 pm to chase up. We had to ring in at 9:55 pm to check what was going on. Note on file apparently said she called us back but no response  the phone was right beside us and no missed calls. The second advisor said our delivery had been cancelled due to driver sickness (so presumably we could have been informed in advance and made other plans). The advisor has rescheduled the shop to tomorrow and despite this poor customer service has only offered a paltry ¬£10 off and felt like this issue was simply swept under the rug and of very little  importance. In doing so they have removed a ¬£5 saving  so essentially this is ¬£5.   We will be calling in the morning to cancel the order as the contact centre is closed and as we currently have an inclusive delivery package we will be cancelling this also and doing future shops with a competitor.  Very disappointed with the service we have received.

You may be a big company but you don t know anything about customer service and if I acted in this way my company would soon be out of business. This is an absolute joke. I m currently feeling very concerned that my Clubcard account has been hacked for the second time in six months.  The first time when initially contacting Tesco I was told that as the vouchers had been spent I must have redeemed them myself. After a long call to Tesco I eventually convinced the representative that it hadn t been myself that had used the vouchers. On further investigation it was established that my account had been hacked and the vouchers had been sent to an email account that wasn t mine.Unfortunately I had to wait until my next statement for my points to be credited to my account. This was very disappointing as I had intended to use the vouchers for something specific in the lead up to Christmas.  Today I logged into my account to find that ¬£73:00 worth of vouchers had been used on 19.03.16. I was astonished to see that my account had  been hacked again. I called the Clubcard helpline and spoke to Ewan who was very helpful and quickly established that the transaction in my account was already being dealt with by the fraud team . He was able to confirm that the vouchers had been redeemed for Pizza Express and sent to an email address that didn t match mine.  This has left me concerned regarding  the security and again very disappointed as I am unable to book the hotel that I intended to book using my vouchers for a special celebration. I have been informed that I will have the points returned to my account in the next few days . I hope this is the case and that I don t have to wait for my next statement as I did last time.  I urge anyone with an account to check it as there is clearly a problem. I know that ¬£73:00 isn t a massive amount but that isn t the point. As a customer who spends ¬£1000 s a year with Tesco I would like to think that my loyalty rewards are safe.

Dear tesco customer services I m sat here in tears at the actions of your rude delivery man!  Who came to delivery my delivery as usual 11am  He came to the door with my shopping in crates as usual with my empty crates at the front.  The first words before anything else was are those crates covered in cat urine ?! I always wash my crates off with soapy suds before being collected as they ve been outside waiting for delivery to arrive which is what I said.   I just always wash them    He said I can t take them they re covered in urine.  He wouldn t lift my crates into the house and I had to struggle to do as my home help doesn t arrive until 12 and I m not suppose to lift after my cancer operation   I am disabled but my disability is not apparent by looking. The delivery man insisted I unload my groceries but i Said I couldn t   He then stormed off and said im talking to my manager  where he told his manager (I Presume ) that my trays where covered in urine and that I wouldn t unload my groceries as  she said she s disabled   I m sure the driver will deny the raised tone of disbelief  in his voice. Unfortunately I can t prove that  He came back from his van and said I m not taking them they re covered in cat urine.  I said that s your interpretation  not mine  he said well you told me last time they have. I said last time when. He said last time I did  your deliver. (I don t have memory of this due to my disability but i always wash the trays in Case a cat has been around and if that s true then he took them away anyway)  I said but I ve told you those ones are clean. He said I can t take your word for that. Which I then pointedly asked does that mean you do no believe what I am saying so technically Calling me a liar ? He said I don t believe what your saying but I m not calling you a liar. Asked me to sign for the shopping and told me his manager will ring me !  How can I ever use Tesco again. I would like my  delivery pass few reimbursing please. I can t explain the level of anxiety this has given me.  That was a very rude man who had obviously preconceived ideas.  my crates go back cleaner then they come. ! Tesco.  I have just watched a video on the effects the objectification of women has on society as a whole. My son  who is just 10  didn t quite understand how the media plays a role in this. I grabbed the first magazine I could find to demonstrate  and this happened to be your February 2016 edition of Food Family Living. I am horrified at just how bad it actually is.  Your magazine shows countless images of women and children baking in the kitchen or shopping for food. It also shows one image of a woman in a bath (you only see her face). All these women and children are in full makeup  with not a hair out of place. There was also a drawing of a woman waving her husband goodbye as he drives away from the home.  The magazine also contained two pictures of men. One is an advertisement  in which the man wears a matador costume. While this is undoubtedly supposed to be funny  it does once again portray the man as a strong protector. The ONLY OTHER picture of a man in your entire magazine is one of a dad out on a bike ride with his sons  placed next to an image of a woman baking with her daughter.  I wonder if you realise that you are upholding serious gender stereotypes  and that these types of attitudes are what allow sexism to continue to exist. I would welcome a magazine in which these gender stereotypes are not present. In which you show people as they really are.  #IStandUp #WomenNotObjects #FeminismMatters

To whome it may concern  I nipped into your Hanley store today and was slightly confised to see a number of groups of people loitering around the fruit and veg isles  i didnt really know what they were doing at first they werent shopping they were just waiting. a few minutes later what they were waiting for became clear when every ran in what i can only describe as a stampede towards trolly of reduced veg.Then a minute later everyone ran over to the next trolly i didnt even get to see the poor memeber of staff whos job it was to wheel these trollys out i can only assume he ran to saftey at the site of a crazy mob of people stampeding towards him (and stampede i asure you is no over exageration!). Grapes went flying all over the floor and there was no manners or organisation from anyone. I found this to be DISGRACEFUL this situation (which i assume is a weekly occurrence based on the number of people loitering around) could easily result in someone getting injured. People were pushed and shoved and barged past  trollies were blocking the isle preventing me from doing my own shopping! Grapes flying everywhere is clearly a health and safety issue  and whichever memeber of staff is tasked with the mark downs must genuinly fear for there safety when they wheel that trolly out. This is not acceptable as it is your duty as a company to prevent stampedes in the middle of your stores! Clearly these items are frequently marked down at the same time each day.... i feel that this is dangerous based of the behviour i have seen tonight and it is only a matter of time before someone is injuried! It also prevents  anyone elsing getting a look in at the reductions  times are hard for alot of people and it should not be just those who act like animals who get to benefit from the reductions. Staggering the time at which reductions are made into no predictable pattern would surely reduce this animalistic behaviour and ensure the saftey of both your customers and your staff!  I will look forward to hearing off you in regards to this issue.  Many Thanks Amy

Congratulations on reaching the final question to qualify for the role of  Tesco Home Delivery Shop - Product Picker . Your final question is this:   Your customer has selected Tesco s Poppadoms. Upon selecting one packet (if available)  do you: A) Place anywhere into a bag with other light items (e.g. Crisps  biscuits etc) B) Place at the bottom of a bag and load at least 6 heavy cans on top as well as other heavy grocery items C) Place into a bag ensuring they are close to or on top of other products  If you selected anything other than B  you have failed.

Annoyed at Tesco- recently received a flyer through our door regarding currency- ¬£5.00 off for every ¬£500 spent for Clubcard customers we go to our Extra store in Chesterfield as per the leaflet and guess what not a single dollar at the counter- what was the point in that! Visited the Great Harwood store today. Tried to purchase a boys tee + a girls tee in the  2 items for ¬£5  range  only to be told that I can t do that....it must be 2 boys items or 2 girls items. At the dusky hour of 6am Thursday morning I whizzed through my online shopping order for collection Saturday morning. The shopping app is awesome.  Several things planned for Saturday so I ordered an early collection slot.  Saturday morning came and I drove down to collect my shopping on route to doing several other things.  When trying to collect my shopping I was told that there was no paperwork for it as their printers were not working or something. At this point my stress levels rose thinking how I could fit the extra work of checking bags into my busy plans or going out to get missing items!!  I would have to check it all at home and ring the help line if there were items missing or substitutes I didn t wish. I could get a refund...not helpful if I needed something for dinner tonight!!  I refused to sign for it not knowing what I had paid for. I was very annoyed at the lack of basic organisation. It took me half an hour to finish checking and unpacking at home  not to mention sorting out the excessive bag usage.  Fortunately it was all there and I didn t have to go out to buy items which I might have needed. However this made me late in doing the other things I had planned. I had to ring around and alter plans. Something which is designed to be quick and easy to take away the stress of shopping  which I hate anyway  was highly stressful!!! As a busy working mum I rely on Tesco s to help keep me sane!!! Today was not a help.  Tesco Winnal you failed me!!!

Terrible service regarding order number 496THF8BM. Item delivered to incorrect address as system will not allow amendment to default main address. Courier of Tesco partner has left item  in secure location  which I haven t been informed where it is or when it was delivered so I have no idea where it is; no call from courier to say trying to deliver. Tesco customer service called to say they couldn t do anything as policy with Tesco partners for the courier driver to decide where secure location is  manager then came on the phone and suggested  round the back near the bins  would be an appropriate secure location. No offer of what Tesco could do or what they may amend to stop this happening again. No offer to get IT to review why address unable to be amended and only after strong urging by myself said they will ask Tesco partner to ask courier where it has been left  but not until Monday (surely first question you ask!). Clearly no one wanted to be working on a Saturday and was passed to a manager without advising so  in an attempt to just get rid of me. Told both that there was another ¬£300 worth of products I wanted to buy but why would I after this experience. Neither person seemed to care  just wanted me to hang up or swear so they could end conversation. No apology either for situation  or empathy. Customer service at an all time low.
