It pays to shop around if you want to save money  getting value for money and if you have the time. If I wanted to buy a box of Calvin limescale tablets I would pay ¬£5 25 in my local (Paddington Metro Branch) Tesco when I can buy them for ¬£5 00 at the market stall outside the store. A pack of Everyday Value toilet rolls 4 in the pack is ¬£1 21 whilst I would pay ¬£1 at the stall. Even a tube of Mento mints at 63p each 2 for ¬£1 20 a saving of 6p (yes) but I can buy 4 rolls for ¬£1 in Poundland. I m sure there are many others too.

I have just done my weekly shop at your store in Buckingham. I took my 19 month old daughter with me and whilst we were half way through our shop she projectile Vomited all over herself and the shop floor. Having gone shopping in her fairy dress and peppa pig wellies ( as you do at 19 months of age) it was not an ideal situation. I had a very upset little girl covered in sick and hand full of sick that I had managed to catch. A vey kind customer assisted me and sought help from Adam the Bakery manager. He could not have been more helpful if he tried. He helped me clean my daughter up and even took a pair of pyjamas of the shop floor and gave these to me for free. He then went even further and help me to dress my daughter. He offered to keep my shopping to one side if I wanted to come back later and then bagged up all of my daughters clothes that were covered.  I really wanted to show my appreciation in some way so felt this message may get back to him. I did speak to the store manager but he didn t seem that bothered or interested in what I had to say.  I cannot thank Adam enough!

I m horrified to hear you have moved on an innocent young man who puts a little of light entertainment outside your Madeley store !  He s busking and giving a little pleasure to your shoppers and as done for a long time .....To be removed likes hes a thug is disgusting to hear !! As I made my way towards the inviting ease of the sliding doors  the ever promising delight of a hot lunch was enlivening my taste buds. My senses were heightened but the element of ever increasing danger loomed. A mass flock of hungry bellys and frustrated minds were encroaching on my normally pleasant breeze through the entrance. The fight was on....As my pace quickened  the mass  as if telepathically raiding my thoughts also picked up pace. Was it me? Or was the mass involved in a civil war that I would be mere collateral damage too? No matter. In my steed like blinkered manner  I waded through the mass  taking diversions and shortcuts through the milk aisle to my destination. Tripping up the opponents as I poured through them like fluid. Boom! Front of the line  I had  championed the lunch time brigade! As the mass of 50+ academy pupils waged war over the 25 bags of chicken nuggets  I sighed with relief and ordered the good lady (who was shaking with fear of the mass) to fetch me my bacon ribs. Tesco hot deli at 1pm! It s a rough business folks.  As written by my son Danny Lyons on his Facebook page yesterday   so very funny and true   hope you enjoy.

Well last night s supposed shopping delivery was a bit of palava!Shopping delivery was booked for 7-8pm slot. 8.40pm comes around....still no shopping! It seemed a bit unusual as previously  if the driver was ever going to be late  they ve always called to let me know.I give Tesco a quick call to see what s occurring. After explaining situation to chap on the phone  he gets hold of driver and is told that driver had delivered it at 7.20pm. REALLY????? Errr......no  he did not!!!! Am I the only occupant? No! Could another member of the household have taken it in  signed for it and forgotten to mention it? Err yeah  that ll be it! I live in  a 3 bed semi  not Downton Abbey! I think I d notice if the shopping arrived  that I was waiting to cook for dinner! Several call backs later and it turns out that driver was quite adamant that he had delivered it to the correct house. Well  said driver is clearly MENTAL  or was lying to cover the fact that he d cocked up and delivered the shopping to the wrong house! Inhabitants of wrong house  were at this point  probably feasting on crisps  yogurt and dog food!!! I wouldn t mind so much but the chap on the phone was definitely not convinced  that I was not lying! Why I would want to lie and receive two identical deliveries  an hour apart  I don t quite understand. I m not sure when the old saying about the customer always being right  went out of the window but clearly it no longer applies.  The moral of the story? If someone arrives on your doorstep bearing bags of shopping that you didn t order  don t bloody sign for it you thieving ignoid!!!

Today myself and my support worker were at the Guildford branch of tesco s near the Royal Surrey hospital and Surrey university (just off the A3) I m physically disabled and so I use the scooters at tesco s. Usually my support worker has to go back and forth to get the security guard to come and drive it in and out of the car park as she doesn t feel comfortable driving it. Today I was transferring into her car whilst she went to fetch the guard when all of a sudden a young lad (he can t have been older than 13) rode over on his bike and tapped my window. He asked if I was ok because he saw my support worker leaving me. I explained where she had gone and he said  would you like me to help and drive it back in  I ll meet your friend and save her walking all the way in?  I was so taken aback by this helpful and thoughtful young mans offer and I said that would be very kind  he asked me to watch his bike and he drove the scooter back inside! Me and my support worker were both so shocked and touched by his caring and understanding nature that we didn t think to get his name. However we did chat with him and he is doing work experience on the canal by the post office depo and near tescos in Guildford and he is driving the boats. We couldn t thank him enough for being so considerate  if anyone knows who this young man is can you please get in touch with me? I would like to thank him personally and explain to him how much it meant to me to have someone helping me not laughing and staring. In the words of my support worker  you see? Not all people are bad!

Tesco  why do you refuse to in force the rules of the parent and child parking spaces in your supermarkets? There are clear signs stating that the spaces are for people to park in who have children under the age of five with them. Every time I go to Tesco I see ignorant people who do not have young children with them parking in these spaces and they continue to do so because they do not care and they know that they can. Your signs say that you have marshals patrolling the area  yet in all the years I have been shopping at Tesco  I have never seen anyone in forcing it. Parents and carers with small children really do need these spaces so that we can open our car doors wide enough to get our children out of their car seats. It s not fair that people take advantage of them. If you re not going to have marshals on patrol then you need to come up with a better system so that these spaces cannot be just parked in by anyone. If you are reading this and you are someone that parks in these spaces without children  please stop to consider why it is so necessary that you leave these spaces for people that need them!  Please share this post if you agree!

I ve got a .com delivery coming today  as drivers looked a bit unsafe in the past I ve brought in a new procedure. Even if your driver arrives in his window we might busy  in which case he will have to wait for an hour or so while we decide if we want it at the front door or back door. Once we ve decided that he will have to hand his keys over and sit on a little chair in the porch  don t worry he won t be lonely as the yodel driver and postman will be there too. We will sell him a cup of nasty coffee if he wants some. We will everything out of the van for him even if it isn t for us. Once we have checked the whole delivery he we will need to sit and wait for another half hour while we create our own paperwork  we know he s got his own paperwork but we only accept our paperwork as proof of delivery. Once we ve done that we will throw all the other stuff back in the van. Give him his keys back and send him on the way. He might be late for his other drops  sorry not our problem - we had ordered stuff before there was room for it so we had to cook dinner first to make room for what was on the van.

Could someone please explain how a sofa delivery could be so royally mucked up?!   We ordered a few weeks ago and when we chased delivery  we were told the delivery would be that Thursday (10/3/16). We stayed in all day on 10/3/16 and there was no delivery. When we chased  we were told that they  meant next Thursday  (ie today - 17/3/16).   Again  we dutifully stayed in doors all day. During this time  we removed our old sofa  which was broken in the removal process. At approx 3pm  we had not received delivery so my husband called to chase. This time when we called  we were told that they had attempted delivery  and no one had answered so they had left a card. No one had knocked and we certainly didn t receive a card.  They claim to have taken a photo of our front door which we are yet to see.  However  this still doesn t prove anything as the photo could have been taken retrospectively.  Somehow in the course of my husband complaining to your offices  our order was also accidentally cancelled!!  So now we are left with no sofa and at present you still have our money!  So we can t even order from elsewhere until this money is returned to us  which will be another 3-5 days.  We have 2 small children  a family room that resembles a  crack den   no money with which to resolve the situation  and a guest staying at the weekend who we had promised could sleep on the new sofa!    I would like to know how Tesco propose to resolve this absolutely farcical situation?!?   I hope that you understand what a difficult situation you have put me and my family in.

Hi!  I just wanted to send my thanks to Sophie at the Bradley Stoke Extra store in Bristol.  This afternoon  I had my two children with me  the younger being just 3 months old. She then scanned all my shopping  packed my bags and filled the trolley back up.  All I had to do was pay. She was a lifesaver today and I want to send my gratitude to her. Another thing. Tesco Everyday Value vegetable grills need to be brought back. They were a tasty vegan option that s not ridiculously expensive like most of the stock you sell that vegans can actually eat. I notice when trying to sort my weekly shop  that Tesco are frequently doing away with cost effective options online and replacing them with items that are 2/3x the price. That or not providing an alternative at all! Due to my disabilities I m not in a position to be hunting around grocery stores analysing labels looking for something edible. Once I find things I can eat and that don t require me to have to spend hours in the kitchen to prepare and cook I like to stick with them (adding to  not reducing what s available to me). It s very difficult for me when my routine is disrupted without notice. My days are hard enough without grocery stores making it harder to shop online for food. Come out of the dark ages British supermarkets and realise the world is changing and that you need to do more than offer 1000 varieties of pulped cattle and confectionery! A great number of people are going vegan these days either to be trendy  ethical or because it actually provides them some health benefits to cut out animal based products. If you can sell cigarettes and cheap booze on your website (very irresponsible) you can certainly make room for a vegan section!

Visited your Stourbridge store yesterday on the pemise to find out the prices on a 1tb ps4 for my partner.  I was informed by a young gentleman that they had one in stock with a set of games  The nathan drake collection   at ¬£319.99. Phoned my partner who agreed he whould like it. So I asked for it to be placed to one side so I could go and collect the money for it from home (please note that I live on Halesowen  so dependant on traffic and when the bus turns up it can be a round trip of an hour) I return back to your Stourbridge banch  ready to pay  the young gent us no where to be seen  but an older gent is on hand to help and brings the ps4 out from the back area to be processed ( I presume the young gent is either on his break or finished for the day). However when I look at the box it doesnt show that it comes with the set of games that I was told it would do. When I asked the older gent he informed me that it doesn t and that if I wanted that one then to go online  also that the ps4 on its owm would cost ¬£319.99 (same price with the game). I explained that the other gent had said it came with the game for the same price only to be told that it wasnt in stock and that was the only 1tb version they had in stock. When I asked if they could put the game in with it (after all I was told that was what I would be paying for)  I was told they couldn t and to go online  talk about misleading   if I d have wanted a 1tb ps4 on its own I could go to asda  game  currys argos and got it for around ¬£300  but being as he was after this set of games with the ps4 then this was the best offer at ¬£10 cheaper. Never the less I feel that sometimes your staff are either misinformed or giving out the wrong information   and this isn t the first time ive had this happen. But rather then disappointing my partner (who had  been saving for a while to buy one) I simply went elsewhere to get one. All I can ask is could you make your staff on the electronic department fully aware of what stock you have in as for me I wasted time to be told something different when I returned to your shop. :(

My Hotpoint Tumble dryer was 4 months old when it started making a horrendous grating noise when in use.  Under consumer law  for this to have developed a fault within 6 months  the fault can be assumed to have been there when it was purchased. I could ask for a replacement or a refund.  My husband phoned Tesco Direct on 29th February and asked for a refund or replacement.  They said we had to deal with Hotpoint. When he questioned this  he was told that an engineer would have to call and look at it and this was the procedure they had to follow before any action could be done.  So an engineer came (nearly 2 weeks later).  He said he would have to order a new front panel and a new drum  which would take almost a week.  Husband phoned Tesco Direct that same day (March 10th) and told them what the engineer had said and that we would like a refund or replacement. Tesco Direct told him that it was nothing to do with them and that we had to deal with Hotpoint. WRONG! By law  the retailer is responsible. Tesco should be aware of this (I m quite sure they are).  We were told that my concerns would be passed to the customer care team and they would be on to it quickly and call us back within 24 hours.    Husband rang again and spoke to Dale (AAD3). He told him that they used Hotpoint as a ‚Äòdropshipper‚Äô and it was their responsibility now.  Husband told him that we purchased the item from Tesco (not a Tesco partner) and it was Tesco‚Äôs responsibility (by law). Asked when the customer care team would contact me but he had no record of my earlier call! He said he would check the recordings of the calls made when we said my call took place and would get back to us.  He rang me back the next day (March 11th) and said he had checked the call and we had indeed been told our complaint would be passed to customer care but this had not happened.  He apologised and said he would himself pass it to customer care and they would get back to us within 24 to 48 hours. He said he would ring the next day to ‚Äòkeep us in the loop‚Äô. It‚Äôs now 15th March and we‚Äôve had no call from anyone at Tesco.  Been unable to use the dryer for nearly 3 weeks now.  Tesco are blatantly breaking the law by saying it is nothing to do with them.  I do not want major repairs doing on an appliance that was 4 months old when I reported the fault.  I have the right to a refund or replacement.  Tesco know this but just try to fob you off.  Will never buy items like this from them again.

Dear Mr. Tesco   I`d just like to take a moment to offer my sincere thanks and appreciation in relation to my recent experience with your customer services department.  To give you some background to this tale of woe  I purchased in good faith  a Hotpoint washing machine from your good selves in October 2015.  Having purchased many other white goods appliances from yourselves in the past  I looked forward to a smooth  hassle free and long lived ownership of this essential nay necessary; kitchen item.  Alas  as it turned out  we never actually received confirmation of delivery of the washing machine and it wasn`t until we actually contacted you to advise you of this  that we were informed you could not deal with this and we had to deal directly with Hotpoint.  Somewhere along the line  after numerous phone calls and a great deal of time listening to your delightful hold music  a confirmed delivery date was agreed  some 7-10 days after the original date.  Fast forward to the 21st February 2016 when  in time honoured tradition our (almost) brand new washing machine began to experience intermittent faults and a blatant refusal to operate.  No amount of coaxing  verbal abuse or whipping with a willow branch seemed to alleviate the issue.  ‚ÄúNo problem‚Äù I thought.  ‚ÄúHotpoint will sort us out.  No worries.‚Äù  Here begineth the problems.  Upon calling the number affixed to the front of the machine  we were advised by a rather dreary sounding customer services chap on the end of the phone that we could not and should not  expect anyone to come out and look at our issue for at least 8 days.  Nonetheless  he would be more than happy to sell me additional insurance cover  in case my appliance developed further faults down the line.  Why Hotpoint are training their customer service operators to sell insurance on a fault line is pretty much beyond me; nonetheless I digress.  As we were in no position to argue  we were forced to acquiesce to this proposal and looked forward to the forthcoming 8 days of dirty clothes accumulation.    Here`s where it gets interesting.  Shortly thereafter  I received a phone call from a rather cheery customer services rep to let me know that despite assurances  no one in fact would be coming out to repair the washing machine on the agreed date as the fault code we were experiencing would in fact require replacement parts  which  guess what. were not in stock.  Upon enquiring when stock would be available  the closest I could get was ‚Äúsoon.‚Äù  Excellent.  I love ‚Äúsoon‚Äù.  It`s what I often tell my children when they ask about a raise in pocket money. ‚ÄúSoon.‚Äù  It was at this stage that I had an epiphany and realised that the original purchase of the washing machine was actually through Tesco and not Hotpoint and therefore resolved to pass the issue to your good selves  particularly as Hotpoint were being about as useful as King Canute was turning back the tide.   Sadly  my misguided optimism in your ability to speed up the repair process or at the very least provide a definitive timescale  proved beyond your capabilities.  I`m not sure why it proved so difficult to locate a spare part but in my head I imagine a scenario akin to King Arthur attempting to locate a shrubbery.  A nice one. Nevertheless  both myself and my partner received repeated phone calls to let us know that parts were still not in stock but would be available ‚Äúsoon.‚Äù  I love that word.  I really do.  Soon.  We also received more than one phone call from you explaining that the service we had received was not what could and should be expected and that you were prepared to make a ‚Äúgesture‚Äù following the successful repair  of our forlorn washing machine.  Needless to say  we were both on tenterhooks after being advised of this.  The extent of the gesture was to remain a secret though.  Nothing like anticipation.  I`m sure you can appreciate at this stage  being without a washing machine was beginning to incur significant difficulties  particularly when trying to find a clean pair of kecks to wear in the morning.  I`m no prude  but I do enjoy the feeling of freshly washed cotton (and sometimes satin) on my backside of a morning.  I`m not averse to turning the old Y-fronts inside out to get some extra wear but by this point  the situation was getting critical.  My partner however  is slightly less forgiving and refuses point blank to even consider turning anything inside out at any time.  She`s a keeper!  After a considerable delay  we received confirmation that the (by now) mythical spare parts had been located (hurray) and would be available for install on the 11th March 2016 ( a good 19 days after first reporting the fault).  I`m happy to report that  the mission was a success and our washing machine is currently operating at maximum capacity and my buttocks are once again clad in freshly laundered undergarments.   The tale of woe finishes with the ‚Äúgesture.‚Äù  Whilst we are under no illusions that a gesture need be provided  following the conversations we had with your (very apologetic) customer services team combined with the length of time we have been without a washing machine  the gesture received is somewhat lacking.  When I say lacking  I mean non-existent. Nada. Nowt. Nothing.  Less substance than the contents of a partially filled whoopee cushion.  Not even a shrubbery (nice or otherwise). Needless to say  the whole experience has been particularly disappointing and it`s highly unlikely we will approach you for any future white goods purchases.  Or if we do  it`ll be‚Ä¶‚Ä¶‚Ä¶‚Äùsoon‚Äù

I have been a loyal customer of yours for years. I save my clubcard points  I use Tesco to fill both cars  we buy all our shopping from you on a weekly basis  we buy top up shopping from you  we purchase presents  we even have our car insurance through Tesco. Yet yesterday there was an issue with my card and instead of calling me about this Tesco decided to just not turn up. My delivery was due on my only day off between 12-1pm. I waited in for this and at 1:20 I called and questioned where it was. I was told that it had been delivered  clearly not as to why I was calling asking where it was. He then called the shop and they informed that the van had it and had missed it and payment had been declined. He came back to me and apologised as they should have contacted me. (My contact details being correct as I was contacted 3 times last week about my delivery being over an hour late) the man on the phone then explained that they had retried the payment and it was successful and the delivery was still on the van so I would be contacted shortly as to what time it was to be delivered. I waited and by 6pm realised that maybe the shopping I had now paid over ¬£70 for was not coming.... Kids then went to school today  had to explain why there was no pack lunches and why they were to have school dinners  extra expense  then I had to go to work without breakfast and lunch  had to buy  extra expense. Came home to still no food and I called back up. The best bit still to come..... They would have had no idea that it wasn t delivered had I not called! And ......it wasn t to be delivered! And then the options I m given. Wait for it.... I can pay again üòÇüòÇüòÇ or I can not have my shopping delivered. Let me explain. I can pay again and have the previous money refunded then they can arrange a delivery  I assumed for tomorrow  or I can just have my money refunded and not have my shopping. I know I was so torn as to which to choose I almost lost my mind with excitement. When I asked if he was being serious he actually said yes üòê so now I m still without food. I have to go to a shop WITH my children üò©üò© and do a full shop load. I know it s done but for many years I have deliberately paid for a delivery saver and religiously arrange my shopping to be delivered as this feels me with horror with all your strategically placed products it costs me a fortune!!  On a more serious note though I am appalled and have cancelled my delivery saver and will not be shopping with you again. For a loyal customer  in fact any customer  to be treated like that is very very bad and irresponsible of a company like yourselves to do.

Baby milk violations in Tesco Withernsea ..... Under the UK Infant Formula and Follow-on Formula Regulations (2007) companies must not:      advertise infant formula to the public or make the brand or ingredients the main focus in follow-on formula advertising to the public (RG 21/GN 48).     promote infant formula at point-of-sale by special displays  shelf talkers or discounts etc (follow-on formula products and promotion should not be placed by infant formula). (RG 20/GN53).     promote infant formula in mailshots or emails to the public  even when the recipient has agreed to receive communications (ASA ruling A12-197524).     put health and nutrition claims on labels (unless on a small list of permitted claims) or use other idealising text or images on infant formula (such as hearts  shields  animals) (RG 17/GN 32).     pay for television programmes to show their infant formula or follow-on formula products.     target health workers with gifts or idealising product information (RG 21) (be wary of company events  sponsorship and reps wanting to meet).     provide information materials for use in health facilities without prior written approval from the Secretary of State for Health (RG 24/GN 74-79).

I have just visited your Tesco Extra store in Stockport at 10:30am where we went to purchase a lunch for our walk today. We were shopping approximately 5 minutes. We went to pay  but apparently we were not able to pay until 11am.  This is perfectly reasonable  however I suggested constructively that a sign could be displayed to make people aware (we were not the only people who wanted to pay) I was then told by a member of your team:   it s been the law for years love .   I m not even going to discuss how infuriating it is to be called  love  in such a patronising manner as though this is common knowledge  but more to the point it had nothing to do with the law  I was merely suggesting a sign could be displayed as there were at least 3 other groups of people who walked out behind us for the same reason - WE DIDN T KNOW.  I was further told that they had just done a tannoy announcement (which we had missed as we had just arrived) but the argumentative and passive nature your staff made no sense  I was merely suggesting to make it clearer. I spoke to your staff calmly initially  and suggested a solution for an evident problem and in return I was met my argumentative and defensive staff - I d hate to see anyone that had a genuine complaint or weren t constructive.   So might I suggest to you Tesco - that if you do want to allow people to shop before they can pay  just make it clear. There was NO suggestion while we were in store that we couldn t pay. If you watch your cctv footage of around 10:30 in the morning by the front doors of your store you will see numerous people leaving including ourselves.   I d also suggest training your Stockport managing  and retail staff in some customer service  I ve worked in retail for many years of my life and it seems your staff were looking for trouble or had given up on their role entirely - one gentleman who is supposed to represent your business didn t have a name tag or uniform and yet continued to argue with me and I had to ask him to listen  just to suggest the sign!   If I were in their position is at least be apologetic that a customer had missed this important information rather than patronising them  as it is most definitely the customers inconvenience not your staff s. Hopefully you will see the importance/usefulness of this information to your business unlike your employees that we dealt with today.   Look forward to hearing your thoughts   Lucy

I am really disappointed with a pair of black jeans I purchased from Tesco 2 weeks ago.  I bought the jeans to wear to a family party  I tired them on in store and I love them  they are comfortable and fit nicely! When I arrived at the family party the next day (which was 5 hours away from home) I noticed a large tear in the seem near the pocket  it was safe to say I was frustrated and upset that I couldn t wear my brand new jeans to the party. I exchanged the jeans the next evening at my local Tesco s (East Dereham  Tesco Extra)  but I left feeling aggravated due to the poor service I received - although I was able to exchange the trousers for the same size  I was treated unfairly and accused of  considerably wearing  the jeans  though the labels were attached and I had the receipt  luckily for me a manager was called and was more than happy to authorise an exchange due to the nature of the damage on the goods. I have now had the new pair of jeans for 12 days and am really disappointed to have just discovered a tear in the seem on the leg  despite only wearing them a handful of times. I absolutely love these jeans  they are the correct size and they fit perfectly  but they are clearly made with fabric not suitable for everyday wear/use. I would expect a pair of jeans that cost me ¬£18  to last considerably longer than 2 weeks of light wear.   I am so disappointed as I often purchase clothes from Tesco  but will be hesitate when thinking of buying jeans from Tesco s again.   As these have been worn and because of way I was treated upon returning the original product  I am reluctant to go back in store to seek a solution  as well as being hesitant to seek a replacement after the issues I have encountered.   Please advise me on how I should address this complaint.  I look forward to hearing from you.  Phoebe

Dear administration team for tesco!  I am writing to you in the hope that you will be able to forward my complaint onto the appropriate department as I was just now unable to find the contact number on your website.   I love sweet potato. Words can not describe how much I love sweet potato. If I could eat only one thing for the rest of my life it would be sweet potato. Or cheesecake. It s a pretty close call  but I think sweet potato would win. Anyway  today I bought four  yes four  packets of the sweet potato chips with rosemary and thyme because I am meal prepping and as discussed earlier  I love sweet potato. Normally I would but them fresh  but I thought I would give these a go  because  who doesn t love a bit of rosemary and thyme?   Why do I love sweet potato so much I hear you cry? Sweet potato is extremely healthy   and plus I love the soft texture that comes with it. So imagine my upset when your packet says to cook the sweet potatoes at 200 degrees for 25-30 minutes and 45 minutes later my sweet potato chips are still undercooked and crunchy. I was not impressed. Furthermore  I have an additional 3 packets of sweet potato fries which have also served me an injustice. This is just not acceptable and poor advertising. And trust me  I know how to cook sweet potatoes  if you haven t gathered by now already.   I trust that you will take me complaint seriously and provide me with some compensation as a result of my lack of satisfaction.   Many thanks   Jennifer Eyers.

Hi Tesco   When I was a little girl I loved dinosaurs and dragons and helicopters as well as fairies and flowers and pink fluffy things.. as much as I loved all of my pretty dresses  I m sure you can imagine that back then it was difficult to find clothes outside of the boys clothing section that featured dragons and dinosaurs..  I m now a new mum to a 4 month old baby girl and we absolutely love the F&F range  but I can t help but feel a little bit disappointed that there s still a lack of clothes for little girls that are designed with  tomboys  in mind.    Obviously my little girl has no say in what I dress her in just yet (poor thing!) but I d love her to take after me with all of the things I loved when I was younger.   Girls can love trains and robots as much as they love Peppa Pig and Minnie Mouse  and I think their clothes should reflect their interests. With that in mind  do you think there is any chance of introducing a clothing line from newborn upwards that might be more suited to this kind of thing?   I ve only found a few online stores that cater for girls that like pink AND dragons  but as I mentioned  we love the F&F range  and I d really love to have a more accessible   affordable alternative.  Please keep me updated if there are any plans to bring something like this into the range  I ll be first in line!  Louise

That ¬£300 could pay my rent this month  it could buy me 6-8 weeks worth of shopping  it could pay for a months worth of petrol to get me to my placement where I look after people just like you and me. Good Evening   It is with great regret that I feel the need to put fingers to keyboard this evening and put forward not one  but two complaints with regard to our visit to your Scunthorpe Tesco Extra store this evening (10th March 2016).  One of the main reasons to visit the store this evening was to pick up the new James Bond film and use the ‚Äú100 points when you buy any DVD‚Äù coupon. The item was scanned by Rachel almost in the middle of our grocery shop and just passed straight down  this was then put in to one of our own bags that we had brought along for packing. At the end of the scanning of items Rachel gave us the total price and we handed over the coupon to redeem our free points  at this point Rachel advised us that we hadn t bought a DVD or Blu ray and so we could not have the extra points  I pulled the film out of the bag and showed it to her  then  much to my amazement she told me ‚ÄúWell  that hasn t gone through my till  YOU must have just put it straight in to your bag without paying for it.‚Äù I protested my case and told her it had been scanned  she proceeded to tell me  in an ever increasing accusatory tone that I had bypassed the till with the item and that even the security tag hadn t been removed. Eventually she checked her monitor in front of her and said: ‚ÄúNo it definitely hasn t gone through  you have just put it straight in your bag.‚Äù so Rachel took the film  scanned it and removed the security tag  we paid and as I had already seen the item listed twice on the receipt (once at the very end and once in the middle of the itemised bill) I showed Rachel the receipt and the fact the same item HAD been scanned twice and therefore I had not bypassed her scanner. An apology was not even mentioned  instead she called one of her colleagues over  Helen  and said ‚ÄúI ve made a boo-boo and scanned this twice‚Äù No apology for basically accusing me of attempting to commit an act of shoplifting. To say I was upset would be an understatement. To Compound this even further  and my secondary complaint  Helen (one of the ladies who patrols the areas by the tills just in case of queries) laughed at me when I expressed my displeasure at being accused of attempted theft. Helen told me (after laughing) ‚ÄúRachel has been here a lot of years she wouldn t mean it like that‚Äù I m not really too fussed if Rachel has been there two days or twenty years  to accuse someone of theft  when the evidence is clearly available on screen and on the receipt  is beyond anything I have experienced before from a customer service focussed organisation such as yourselves.   I myself work as a manager for a large industrial solutions and supply company and have to deal on a daily basis with some of the largest blue chip companies across Europe  if I had shown such a poor attitude to my customers  as your staff have shown towards me and my family this evening  I would be losing contracts all over the place. And more seriously  if I had accused some one of trying to steal from me without valid grounds or checking first  I could be facing legal repercussions also.  The only thing I can say is that the young lady at customer services who did credit one of the films did apologise for any inconvenience  but by this point I had had enough. I made my feelings clear (in a polite manner) to all that were involved  but I feel that two of the individuals  Rachel & Helen  clearly were not very focused on their customer service skills  or  general manners this evening  and  as a consequence I am not at all a happy shopper.  Yours Sincerely Stuart Skelton

On January 16th I brought two packs of lamb chops. Both reduced. The first pack was absolutely rancid. It stank. The smell was revolting. I am a chef and noticed straight away. Maybe someone else would not have noticed and eaten them. They would have been very ill.  I defrosted the other pack today. I was dubious about this pack. When I opened them they were the same. Really not good. I had to go out and get something else for dinner.  Again not good  a mile walk to the nearest supermarket  another mile walk home. After a day at work I wasn t happen I had to go back out. I complained before and was given a ¬£5 gift card! If I was a pensioner and eaten those I d have been quite sick. To offer a fiver for something so rancid is a joke.  I was told that was more than tesco would normally offer.  When they were brought they went straight into my freezer so it s not like I had them sat around.  I am appalled that two packs can be the same quality. Hello  I visited the opticians at Tesco  Extra Accrington yesterday   (8th February) and I would like to comment on what a pleasurable experience  this was.  I arrived for my 3.10pm appointment however due to an online booking error as I hadn t realised that I needed to confirm through an email link to verify my booking so  I was not on their system. The staff on duty were very welcoming and tried their best to fit me in between appointments however the customers were arriving for their appointment slots and to save me waiting around a lovely colleague named Leanne very kindly got me a free drink and chocolate bar with a magazine to wait in the cafe until an appointment came free before the 4.50pm slot that I was now booked in. Her personal skills were impecable  she is such a credit to your store and a valuable addition as I believe that she has only just been transferred  from the Blackpool store a week ago. She sought out to ensure that I had a relaxing wait and as a busy mum herself she realised an hour or two away from motherly duties is a luxury. It so happened that somebody didn t turn up for their appointment so I was seen a bit earlier. I had my eye test and purchased my first pair of glasses with the help and encouragement  of Leanne.  I would definitely recommend  Tesco Accrington Opticians for their professionalism and excellent person centred approach to customers. Please can you ensure that this message of appreciation  is relayed back to the store. Thank you and regards  Miss Aimee Smallman

Theres not alot of difference between supermarkets these days....unless you visit their cafes. I have noticed this in its extremity today.  I am a frequent visitor to Sainsburys cafe. However  today I chose to visit the Thetford Tesco branch for my lunch to see what they had on offer.  As you enter the cafe  it seems to have a nice atmosphere  looks clean and seems laid back enough for the casual luncher. Unfortunately  looks can be deceiving. Behind the counter were four of the most sour faced people I have ever met. They looked like they had just been told the Bank Holiday was not being paid  all future Christmasses were cancelled and their favourite puppy had just been hit by a bus. They didnt dare to make eye contact lest I ask them to do something for me and  despite standing there for a good 5 minutes  I was not even welcomed with a  hello  or even a  be with you in a minute  despite my being the only customer there.  The person on the till at least looked me in the eye like a fellow human being and smiled when I d paid for my Chili Con Carne  offered me a cup for my soda and told me my food would be brought to me. She was the cheeriest of the bunch and to be honest had she not have been so welcoming  I would have turned on my heel and left.  When my food arrived  I was taken aback. It looked worse than hot dinners I had mournfully eaten at school. The Chilli Con Carne should ve been called Chilli Sin Carne (Chilli WITHOUT meat.) I mean  to be fair there was a relatively large amount of sauce  but there was nothing that I would call meat in there. Some beans which broke up the monotony of eating a meal someone without teeth could ve swallowed but no actual meat content. There was a lot of spice in there too.....and I eat hot curries but I think the aim of the Chilli Con Carne is that you are still meant to be able to eat the sauce without the insides of your mouth peeling off.  As for the rice? It added as much to the dish as a piece of parsley balanced precariously atop a pan fried venison - but at least the parsley looks good. I have chewed rice cakes that had more moisture than that which was in the rice I was served today.  All in all it was such an underwhelming and disappointing visit that I wont be darkening your door step in the future  choosing instead your more orange cousin for my lunching needs.

Your brand guarantee and promises of not paying less anywhere else are a complete con! I am starting up a small business making sweet hampers and I purchased some Easter eggs from you knowing they were each 25p cheaper in sainsburys and having faith that the money would come off at the till. After paying i realised the money had not been taken off and I queried it with a member of staff who said it is based on the whole shop and not individual items! What is the point of that? Anyone can shop round several supermarkets and work out that buying different things in different shops is saving money. The whole point of the brand guarantee is so that you can shop with peace of mind knowing that you will never pay more for ANY item and without the hassle of shopping round! Especially when starting a new business profit margin is very important. I am very disappointed in tesco and will not be shopping there anymore. You are misleading people with your brand guarantee banners flooding the stores. 3p saving on a ¬£67 shop is deplorable!!

So disappointed with the service received in the shettleston branch this evening.  Wanted to exchange my Dulce Gusto machine as it was faulty.    When I was at the service desk I pressed the buzzer for help. I waited for a few minutes and one of the assistants came  completely ignored me used the computer and walked away.  I pressed the buzzer again  again waited for another 5 mins when the same assistant came back.   I explained that the coffee machine was faulty and produced the receipt.  The assistant looked at the receipt  took the the machine out of the box and told me I would have to call the customer service number  because I was out of the change your mind guarantee.  I explained that I hadn t changed my mind  the unit had been faulty for weeks and I was just looking for an exchange. I was told to take it away and call the number.  When I explained I work unsocial hours as I work for the emergency services and it is not easy for me to wait in for things to be collected.  I specifically brought it into store as this was easiest option and I had someone take me as I don t drive and couldn t manage on the bus.  I am very disappointed I would have expected better.  When I eventually agreed to go home and call the number as the assistant could see I wasn t happy with this option I was told you can speak to a manager if you like.  I was soo disappointed with the service and attitude   I packed the coffee machine up myself as the assistant couldn t work out how it all went back in. If she had no intention of exchanging it why on earth did she take everything out of the box.  I did not want to speak to a manager in store as  shouldn t have to  to get a faulty item exchanged.    The machine was purchased just after Christmas 2015 and broke in February 2016.  I have spent a lot of money purchasing pods and accessories for it.  Not impressed Tesco won t be purchasing anything else like this from you!

To Whom It May Concern I am postin regarding a black tie charity evening we are setting up on behalf of row2recovery.Row2recovery were the first ever all amputee crew to row the Atlantic Ocean.Together they have raised thousands for their charitable interests of Help for Heroes Blesma and Prince Harrys The Endeavor Fund.We have been humbled by the generosity of businesses and such like giving us either their venue services or auction items all totally donated which will hopefully raise thousands more. We are in search of auction items for the evening and would be extremely grateful if you could find anything possible to donate.The four man team are either full amputees or part and between them  have only 3 legs.They will be giving a talk at Henley River & Rowing Museum on Sat 19th March if you wanted to find out more about these heroic ex servicemen.Also you can look on the website @row2recovery.I very much hope you can help and anticipate hearing from you. Thank you  so much for your time. Sharon Brown. I have the honour of being related to Colour Sergeant Lee Spencer.

Whilst I read many posts regarding bad service  complaints etc regarding many supermarkets  I think it s only fair that good service etc should also be recognised. I regularly shop in one of the tesco express shops (Woodside street  Coatbridge  Lanarkshire) and the staff there are excellent. As a wheelchair user  each member of the staff go out of their way to help and assist me with all my needs. They are polite  courteous  cheery and extremely hard working. They all take the time to chat and if I ve not been in the shop for a few days  they always ask  on my return  if I m ok  if I ve been ill etc. We regularly hear of bad customer service  but this is certainly not the case in the Woodside Street shop. Each member of staff are ambassadors for your Company and you should be extremely proud of them. A special mention for the young boy who regularly serves me (unfortunately  I can t remember his name). He is a lovely  cheery young man who goes out of his way to help and nothing is ever too much trouble for him. Congratulations to whoever interviewed and hired the staff here  they did an excellent job and I hope each and everyone of them continue to be there and serve me for a very long time. üëèüëèüëèüëèüëè

Dear Tesco  Do you train your staff to do their utmost best to find excuses to not accept coupons?  Coupons printed by your own tills too?  I was so frustrated this morning when I presented the cashier with a voucherfor Nappies  and asked if she could scan it to see if it goes through. She insisted the coupon would not work because I had pants and the coupon said  Nappies .  I kept asking her if she could just try to scan the coupon to see if it works  then finally she turned around to discuss it with the cashier behind her  in her own language.  It seems because that cashier told her to give it a try  she finally decided she actually would.  At this point I was ready to move all my shopping and find the manager if she wasn t going to scan this coupon.  In the end the coupon went through and she didn t even apologise for making a big deal out it for 5 mins   what would have been the harm in just trying?  This isn t the first time I ve had problems with your staff being stingy with money off vouchers so i just wonder if this is something you make them do  like avoid using them if there are variations with words to trick your customers or something?? I am appalled at Tesco s customer s service at the Hackney superstore. A few months ago I bought a packet of pens (Staedtler Triplus Fineliners  10 Pack) that were secured by a safety alarm of which I was not aware of. Arriving home I placed my pens into the drawer  forgetting about them in the meantime. Coming across these pens again just recently  I realized I could not open them and returned to the store last night at around 8 pm  in which I had purchased them. Upon arrival I immediately approached the security guard (named something like Apher) explaining my situation. He then tricked me into giving him the packet  claiming I had stolen them. He would not give them back to me. I was angered and asked him to call the manager (Charmaine). She told me that unless I had a receipt  I could not get my pens back  also implying that I had stolen them. Now I am left with no pens  no receipt and no proof at all. The manager was not willing to understand my situation  nor engaged me regardless of the situation having occurred due to an initial mistake by an employee  who did not remove the safety strip in the first place. Afterwards she merely dismissed me  claiming she had another customer to attend to.  I am angered due to the fact that my pens were taken from me and that I was accused of being a thief. The company has no right to confiscate my pens without any proof of me having stolen them (which I would like to stress that I did not)  or even without any proof that I purchased them from Tesco. I demand that the pens I have paid for are returned to me. And that the employees at the Hackney store are briefed about the presumption of innocence and their legal rights to confiscate items from customers.

I then mentioned today to the telephone customer services manager (Gareth) that I could post something on social media to make other people aware of the issue and he said there is nothing to stop you doing that so here is my post. Thinking this would be fine  as I had purchased online and knew I had 14 days in which to return an item  I called Tesco.   I was told that I had purchased via a third party being Appliances Direct and given their number. So  I called them.   They informed me that I did have 14 days to return the item  but would have to do so at my own cost and they were based in Derby or Huddersfield! Having obtained courier quotes (most commercial couriers won t take kitchen appliances  as I found out!)  we were shocked to find that it was going to cost ¬£140 to return the Fridge-Freezer!!!!   Obviously  we have to purchase a new Fridge-Freezer  and do not have an additional ¬£140. At no time in the purchase of the Fridge-Freezer through your website was it made clear that any return would be at our expense.   We are a hard-working family and feel we have been treated wholly unfair and are now out of pocket by a considerable amount. This is not a great reflection upon my opinion of Tesco!

My 4 year old son did something exceptionally kind and selfless and as a treat I took him up to tesco in Roborough Plymouth to buy him a hulk smash playdough set to say thank you. I checked with customer services and they said the same. It broke his little heart. He cried his little eyes out and not in a bratty kicking off way  in a really heartbroken way. I have just been shopping at tescos on Huddersfield Road  trying to do the most difficult task of buying a mother s day card for Arron Harris mum  who unfortunately passed away 3 week ago. Whilst looking at cards  we spotted a balloon with the words  best mum ever!!  After having a discussion with the duty manager  Katherine Rhodes  about how long the balloon would last  and explaining about her funeral on Tuesday  she said it would likely last another week. Me and Arron wondered off to look at more cards  when Katherine came over to us  tapped us on the shoulder with the balloon in her hand as said we could have it free of charge and that she was sorry for our loss. To say I broke my heart is an understatement!! Just them two sentences alone was more than enough to restore my faith in humanity. I just wanted to say a massive thank you from the bottom of our hearts for your kind actions at an extremely difficult time. And also a very big thank you to Sharon on the shop floor who spoke to us both for 5 minutes  telling us how sorry she was for our loss. Tesco extra Huddersfield road..... You really did go that extra mile!!! Thank you again from Arron and myself xxxxxx

I am frequent customer at Tesco extra on Pinchington lane  Newbury. I make a minimum of 4 visits a week to this store. I work in retail and I am aware of the pressure put on members of staff. Working in retail I am aware it is clear that customer experience is what increases customer loyalty. Unfortunately  it seems as though customer experience is not a high priority within this store. I often use the tobacco kiosk within the store  I spend a minimum of 15 minutes waiting to be served. There is a clear lack of communication within the store as there is only ever 1 member of staff on the kiosk  I have been in the store with 20 people waiting to be served at the kiosk and there has never been a member of staff to support the kiosk  it is evident the store is run in departments and not everyone is trained or employed to work on this area however  if it is that there is only one person capable to process the tills on this area within the whole store at one time then this is a serious issue within a large store that senior management should be extremely disappointed in. It is an area where customer service is vital which has been let down on many points.   On the 04/03/2016  I came to the store with my sister and her two year old child and 8 week old child. With a distressed and hungry 8 week old child we wanted an easy shopping experience which is something I would expect from Tesco. I needed to purchase a few items (bottled drink x2  cocktail sausages  chicken bites  cigarettes). My sister needed two packs of Huggies pull ups and Cow and Gate baby formula. As I needed to purchases cigarettes and we both had less than 10 items (which is stated in an unprofessional  poorly made  hidden sign above the kiosk) for convenience we thought it would be easier and quicker if we both completed our transactions at the tobacco kiosk. We waited patiently in the line as it continued to grow to a minimum of ten people. As the lady in front completed her transaction the member of staff (Ginny) proceeded to continue her conversation with the customer  stating her unhappiness with the company and her dislike to her job. I was eventually served  the member of staff did not engage in conversation with me nor was I offered a carrier bag  my items were rushed through the till. As my sister stepped forward to purchase her 3 times  the member of staff made a negative comment in a negative tone  you two are sneaky  this was completely unnecessary  after my sister asked what the member of staff implied by her comment she repeated her previous comment  that was just sneaky . I was completely disgusted that she felt  it was acceptable to make this comment in front of a two year old who was very aware of the dynamic and atmosphere.   On a previous occasion  involving the same member of staff. I entered the store at 06:50 am  Ginny told me she could not serve me until 07:00 am  I had no problem with this. I stood and waited  Ginny then engaged in a conversation with another member of staff. At 07:00 I waited as she continued her conversation  I did not want to be rude so I continued to wait. At 07:08 I asked if she would serve me I was told it was not 07:00  when I told her the time she pulled a face and rushed through my transaction.   I am thoroughly disappointed with repeatedly receiving poor customer service within the store. I have previously not mentioned the poor quality of customer service that I have received as I am aware of what happens within stores  however  as this is something that repeatedly occurs it needs to be addressed.

Well Tesco as you say  every little helps .... I have to say your customer service is amazing when you‚Äôre selling your products its first class couldn t be more helpful. My complaint is the aftercare I‚Äôve received....  I purchased a Samsung S6 champagne gold online on the 16/01/16 came within the week I couldn‚Äôt wait to use it although because I spent all that money on it I thought I‚Äôd invest in an otter box defender case  as I had to wait for my case to be delivered my new phone sat in the box as I wouldn‚Äôt trust myself with a phone that cost me ¬£399.97.   Once I got my cover the phone came out of the box and I couldn‚Äôt have been happier with it up until a week ago when my phone started to freeze and not respond then decided to switch itself off and not come back on.  Tonight I rang you‚Äôre company asking for advice and was told it shouldn‚Äôt have gone like that and to take it to a local store and would be given a replacement  so I got in my car and took the phone over to one of your branches at Knoocknagoney  Co Down Northern Ireland‚Ä¶ this is when my opinion of Tesco changed. I explained the situation to one of your colleagues and he rang you‚Äôre support team on advice of what to do  once on the phone it was explained and I got an absolutely ridiculous solution to the situation. I was told that there is nothing you could do for me  I wouldn‚Äôt be getting a new phone in replacement of the broken one  I wouldn‚Äôt be getting my money back  instead I would have to send it to your repair shop to get it repair which would take 2-3 working days for a package to be delivered to me that I put my phone into and return it to yourselves to be fixed which would take 10 days  then I would have to wait for the phone to be returned. This isn‚Äôt good enough the phone is less than 2 months hasn‚Äôt been used from the date I collected it.  I spent my hard earned money on a phone that doesn‚Äôt work correctly  I can‚Äôt get an exchange  I‚Äôm not entitled to my money back to go and buy a new phone  I now have to wait days on this box getting to me.  Then go for 2-3 weeks without a phone‚Ä¶  I need my phone for work. When I asked about a replacement phone the lady from your company said ‚Äúuse an old one  there is nothing we can do‚Äù if my old phone was functioning I wouldn‚Äôt have spent all that money in the first place and I wouldn‚Äôt be in this predicament.  To say I‚Äôm fuming is an understatement  absolute disgrace spending all that money on a phone and knowing that if I get the phone back from repairs it will be a refurbished phone that wasn‚Äôt working for someone else so in fact I‚Äôm getting a second hand phone in replacement for a phone used for 4 weeks!  Future reference I won‚Äôt be buying another phone from yourselves neither will my family and friends and I hope that this is read by other customers and is taken as a warning that if your phone stops working after 14 days of purchase you might as well have thrown your money away‚Ä¶ next time you need a new phone go see Apple. The most unhelpful  disappointing  disgusting  time wasting customer service I have ever received.   Regards  Tamsin  A very unhappy customer.

Posting on here as a last resort  as I seem to be getting nowhere with a satisfactory response  or good level of customer service from either the store in question  or your online customer care team. Last Tuesday I discovered a sharp piece of Perspex - triangular and fairly large in size - in an in-store blueberry muffin which was ordered as part of an online home delivery. This item was in a muffin my five year old son ate; luckily he realised that there was something in his mouth that shouldn t have been. However  I dread to think what would have happened had he swallowed it. I contacted the appropriate departments and can confirm that a gift was sent through with my next home delivery. What I m unhappy about is the promise of calls to update me on this situation - none of which have materialised - and that despite chasing an update myself I have been  in my opinion  fobbed off. This is an extremely serious incident  which could have had unforetold consequences and I naively expected more from Tesco to be honest.  I m contacting you in the hope that this avenue of communication will get me further  and may provide satisfactory answers and a suitable form of apology.

Tesco Express - Exeter Cowick ST - visited at 11.20 am today in my car to pick up some Covent Garden Soup on offer at ¬£1.17.  The customer car park has room for about 40 customer cars and backs onto one of the main roads into the centre of Exeter  probably about 15 - 20 mins walk from Exeter Centre. The car park was full  I nearly didn t stop  as I assumed the store would be busy and queues at the till  I was going to go to Co-op 2 mins drive away but I specifically wanted the Soup offer.  A car pulled out of a an awkward car parking space at the side of the store and I drove into it.  I had found the only car parking space available.  I was stunned or should I say flabbergasted to find out that there were only 3 customers in the store.  The Manager  think he was called Arek  explained that there is no sign up saying customers shopping only or 30 mins maximum  to stop non customers parking there.  One driver parks in the car park everyday and then walks to work  saving ¬£25 a week perhaps on car parking.  All the streets around there  are now residents permit  as drivers were using them for free park and walk to work.  People park in the Tesco car park and walk to work  go to the Doctors surgery  go to Wetherspoons across the road which has no customer parking or shop elsewhere down the road.  This Tesco car park needs signage  limiting parking to customers only 30 mins maximum while you shop in store and some kind of parking attendant.  Bottom line  I thought the store was full due to lack of parking and wouldn t have stopped unless I specifically wanted the soup.  Arek the manager said that he had spoken to a  driver who used the car park all day  parking in the same space daily  explaining that the car park is for customers  not a park and ride  the driver just said  what you gonna doing about it  - word has got round you can park all day  for free - full car park and empty store.  No way can you compare this stores performance and sales targets with other Tesco Express until you sort out the parking fiasco.

In the current climate of trying to save money and retaining customers I would have thought an organisation like yourselves really should be doing more.   A very disgruntled customer who is now considering other options.   Phil

Click+Collect: Not a happy customer!! Ordered an item from you yesterday which said it would be at selected store today and to collect after 3pm today (01.03).  Received an email at 06:00 to say my item has been dispatched. I gave it until well after 3pm and went to selected store to find my item is not even there! So....it s that time of year again. My car insurance renewal was due today and  and I find myself asking why oh why did I renew with Tesco! I really should have known better..... I received an e-mail this morning with a link to download my documents.... Several attempts later  I gave up! The system kept telling me that I may have entered the wrong date of birth or postcode. Now I may get lots of things wrong in life but these really are two pieces of information which I can confidently say I am sure about..... when I was born  and where I live! So two phone calls later to Customer Support and I am told that apparently the leap year is to blame  their systems have been struggling since yesterday. Customers who have requested their policy documents by e-mail will have them sent in the post instead. I was then told that if I want them electronically once they sort their problem out I will need to ring to request them!  So a couple of questions Tesco      I Understand that sometimes unforeseen problems occur with online  systems.But seriously if this is due to the leap year  it can hardly be seen as unforeseen can it? It comes around every four years.....Did you not see this coming?  Was there any customer testing of your system in preparation for this? And secondly why oh why do I have to call back to get my documents electronically  once you sort your system out? Would it not be good customer service to re issue them electronically as a matter of course with an apology for any inconvenience caused?

Just out of interest  I was idly reading the cooking recommendations on my Tesco Broccoli package label. I baulked at the advice to  boil or steam for six to eight minutes.   W H A A A T ??  My florets get 2¬Ω min. in minimal water ‚Äî and that includes the stalks ‚Äî which is spot-on  as far as I am concerned. I can t imagine what kind of soggy mess must result from three times as long cooking (and I m not game to try it.)  I ve discovered also that I can switch off the power at least a minute before cooking time  with there being sufficient residual heat in the ring and pan base to keep the water boiling away. If I do that every day  I ll save some six hours of electricity per year.

Tesco  please do the right thing and STOP offering the choice of caged eggs and battery farmed chickens. Despite what you believe  your customers are not making an informed decision when they buy eggs or chicken meat. Most consumers have no idea what suffering the animal goes through during the egg and meat production process under the so-called  Red Tractor Assurance Scheme .   Free-range eggs and meat are more popular than ever  surely this is a sign that our meat and egg industry  and most importantly the shops that sell them  need to change to meet this ethical demand.   Please don t ignore this issue any longer  or fob us off with a copy & paste answer - make a change and lead the charge. It s the right thing to do.

I would very much like to send my thanks to the man who went above and beyond to help me during this crisis. A small act of kindness made all the difference to such an otherwise awful day.

Just want to say a massive thank you to one of your kind delivery drivers who came to mine and my children s rescue earlier tonight. I d got a flat tyre and couldn t get the wheel undone  I was beginning to panic about how I was going to get the kids home and as we were stuck on a country road  in the dark  in the middle of nowhere obviously my children were getting very distraught thinking we d be stuck there forever. Your delivery driver drove past us and seeing us broken down stopped too see if we were ok  after explaining that I couldn t get the wheel undone and whilst I was trying to reassure 2 children that they would get home your lovely driver offered to help. Not only did he manage to get the wheel off  he also changed it for us and chatted the whole time to me and my children calming us all down and even had the children laughing by the time he d finished. I managed to find out his name was Tony and he was from the Banbury store  please could you pass on our families gratitude to him and make sure this lovely man gets the recognition he deserves. He really went above and beyond for us tonight when I m sure he was probably busy with deliveries but still made time to come to our aid. Thank you so much Tony  you re a star!!! Xx
